Colorado Scholarships


1Lt. Eriks L. Sudmalis Scholarship
1) Sophomore, junior or senior enrolled in a CSU degree program and in the Air Force ROTC program 2) Good academic standing 3) Demonstrate honesty, integrity and leadership characteristics more...

1St National Bank Of Durango Entrepreneurship Program Scholarship Award
Scholarship for full-time, continuing, undergraduate students attending Fort Lewis College who are enrolled in the School of Business. Applicants must have completed BA 205 and and write an essay outlining goals with respect to entrepreneurship aspirations. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

1St National Bank Of Durango Entrepreneurship Program Scholarship Book Award
Scholarship for full-time, continuing, undergraduate students attending Fort Lewis College who are enrolled in the School of Business. Applicants must have completed BA 205 and been a member of the student team judged to have best business plan or business developed in BA 205. Award amount is for books. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

2Nd Lt. Donald D. Brooks, Jr. Memorial Scholarship
1) Full-time undergraduate junior or senior enrolled in an undergraduate degree program in any major 2) Attained class status of junior or senior 3) Demonstrate financial need as established by the Office of Financial Aid OR demonstrate special academic achievement 4) Qualify as a Marine Officer selectee under the Platoon Leader Corps Program 5) If there are no eligible recipients who are in the Platoon Leader Corps (PLC) program, recipient shall be a student veteran who has served honorably in the Marine Corps or is an Active member of the Marine Corps Reserves. 6) If there are no eligible recipients who are members of the PLC program, a Veteran who served honorably in the Marine Corps or is an Active member of the Marine Corps Reserves, then consideration shall be given to an Army or Air Force Cadet enrolled at CSU, who will be a Commissioned Officer upon graduation more...

4Th Stone Scholarship
1) Full-time undergraduate enrolled at Colorado State University 2) any College 3) Any major 4) Minimum 2.5 GPA 5) Financial need 6) Recipient has been in the foster care system at any time (e.g., foster home, group home, or placed with a relative by court order etc.) (May be renewable for up to 4 years if recipient continues to meet criteria of Satisfactory completion of 24 credits per year (fall and spring terms) and maintain an overall GPA of 2.5) more...

A. William Schramm Memorial Scholarship

A.J. Parfet Mechanical Engineering Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Mechanical Engineering. Student must demonstrate financial need, academic achievement, leadership ability, and be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Number of awards varies. more...

A.M. Binkley Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate sophomores, juniors or seniors attending Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Floriculture or Ornamental Horticulture. Selection is based on scholarship (minimum 2.0 GPA), leadership, interest in horticulture, financial need and sincerity of purpose. more...

Abby Scott Memorial Scholarship
1) Junior or senior majoring in Agriculture Sciences 2) Minimum cumulative 2.75 GPA 3) Current member of the Livestock Judging Team or have demonstrated interest in joining more...

Abby Scott Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate junior or senior attending Colorado State University full-time, enrolled in the College of Agriculture Science. Selection is based on scholarship (minimum 2.75 GPA), leadership, financial need and sincerity of purpose. Candidate should be a member of Livestock Judging Team or have demonstrated interest in joining. more...

1) Full-time undergraduate chemistry major with a commitment to become a high school chemistry teacher 2) Must maintain a cumulative 3.0 GPA out of 4.0 (or its equivalent 3) Must be a US citizen or a lawful permanent resident 4) Preference given to students with demonstrated financial need when deciding between equally qualified candidates (Scholarship may be renewed if criteria continues to be met until such time as the necessary course-work is completed to obtain an undergraduate chemistry degree and teachers’ certification.) more...

Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at Adams State College. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Preference given to children and grandchildren of Adams State College alumni. Number of awards and award amount may vary. A personal letter must be included with application packet. more...

Students must have a minimum 2.75 GPA. Number of awards may vary. A personal letter must be included with application packet. more...

Aecom Construction Leadership Scholarship
1) Full-time(12 hrs) or part-time (6 hrs) undergraduate students enrolled in the College of Health and Human Sciences 2) Major in Construction Management 3) Sophomore, junior, or senior class level 4) Overall 3.5 GPA 5) Career goals as they relate to the major EPC industry 6) Show leadership and service in CM student organizations as well as community non-university organizations 7) Exhibit interest in roles supporting project management in complex and diverse domestic and international projects more...

Afcea Educational Foundation
Multiple scholarships & fellowships in two general categories: those connected in some way to the U.S. military; and those for the general public. Apply for one scholarship only
Miscellaneous deadline dates:Submit applications no sooner than one month prior to the posted deadline date
Students currently attending accredited colleges or universities in the U.S.; some scholarships require full-time attendance, a few are for part-time attendance; students enrolled in distance-learning programs are NOT eligible
For all undergraduate scholarships, NOTE that high school students are not eligible to apply. Only U.S. military veterans or active-duty personnel are eligible to apply as freshmen; all others must be college sophomores or juniors at the time of application
Must be U.S. citizen, have good moral character, & demonstrate academic excellence. Some scholarships require financial need
For MOST scholarships, candidates are required to be full-time & working toward a degree in one of the following: electrical, computer, chemical or aerospace engineering, mathematics, physics, computer graphic design, computer science or technology, electronics, communications technology, communications engineering, information management systems, or related technical disciplines
At least one scholarship will be available to a woman or minority candidate, provided all eligibility are met
Undergraduate applicants must be a second year college student enrolled as a sophomores or juniors in a four-year institution at the time of application. A current overall GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale is required
Graduate applicants must currently be enrolled in their second semester and at least two (2) semester-equivalent courses per term at an accredited U.S. college or university. A current overall GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale is required.
Check back in January 2016 for the Application. more...

Afton Silver Osguthorpe Memorial Scholarship
1) Given to a PVM student, regardless of class year, who is at a critical point in their professional career, has demonstrated financial need, and exhibited a high potential for success through both academic and outside work activities more...

Applicants must have demonstrated financial need and exhibit high potential for success both academically and in outside work activities. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Agc/Southwest Regional Council Of Carpenters Scholarship
1) Full or part-time undergraduate student in College of Health and Human Sciences 2) Major in Construction Management 3) Sophomore, junior and senior class level 4) Overall 2.5 GPA 5) Must be a Colorado resident 6) Must have at least two semesters remaining toward a degree 7) Must be or have an immediate family member who is a member of the Southwest Regional Council of Carpenters (SWRCC) or works for a construction company with a signed labor agreement. more...

Agency For Healthcare Research And Quality (Ahrq) Grant & Fellowship Programs
*Qualified applicants, particularly minority applicants, who are interested in training opportunities to prepare them for a career in health services research
*AHRQ supports both postdoctoral & postdoctoral training through the National Research Service Award (NRSA) program; AHRQ also supports dissertation grants for doctoral candidates
*NRSA Institutional Training Grants: training grants are awarded by AHRQ to institutions to allow trainees to gain 1 or more years of full-time, supervised experience in applying research methods to the evaluation of health services in preparation for a career in health services research. Candidates for postdoctoral training grants must have a baccalaureate degree & be enrolled in a Ph.D. program or a program leading to an equivalent degree. NRSA grants may not be used to support studies leading to an M.D. Candidates for postdoctoral training grants must have a Ph.D., M.D., D.D.S., Dr.P.H., Sc.D., D.N.Sc., or other doctoral degree. Tuition benefits are provided, as well as stipends
*NRSA Individual Fellowships: these postdoctoral fellowships provide for 1 or more years of academic training & supervised experience in applying quantitative research methods to the systematic analysis & evaluation of health services. Applicants must have a Ph.D., M.D., D.D.S., Sc.D., Dr.P.H., or equivalent doctoral degree from an accredited domestic or foreign institution. This is an ongoing AHRQ program; applications are accepted throughout the year. Recipients receive stipends to help defray living expenses. Must be accepted by an appropriate institution & a sponsor who will supervise the recipient’s training & research experience
*Dissertation Grants: AHRQ supports research undertaken as part of an academic program to qualify for a doctorate. Recipients must be enrolled in a doctoral program which requires a dissertation based on original research in disciplines relevant to health services research. Dissertation grant application receipt dates are May 1 & Nov. 15, annually
*For NRSA individual fellowships & training grants sponsored by AHRQ, contact Debbie Rothstein at above address/phone/e-mail
*AHRQ’S Minority Health Program: this program focuses on both health services research issues & problems that are important to minority individuals & populations & on increasing the participation of minority researchers in health services research. For more info., contact: Lisa Simpson, M.B., B.Ch., M.P.H./Deputy Director/Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality/2101 East Jefferson, Suite 600/Rockville, MD 20852. Phone: (301)594-6662 more...

Agri Beef Scholarship
1) Undergraduate or graduate students enrolled in the College of Agricultural Sciences 2) Have a 3.0 GPA 3) Be involved in extra-curricular activities and/or community projects 4) Have career goals in the cattle and/or beef industry 5) Preference to students with career interests in the Pacific Northwest region of the U.S., especially Washington and Idaho (The scholarship may be renewable if the recipient continues to meet all criteria, reapplies annually and is selected by the scholarship committee) more...

Air Force Rotc Alumni Scholarship
1) Full time undergraduate student enrolled in a degree program as well as the Air Force ROTC program as cadets in any college or major at Colorado State University 2) Demonstrate a sincere interest in a military commission as evidenced by enrollment in ROTC and a firm intention of continuing in the program. more...

Air Force Rotc High School Scholarship-Colorado State University
The Air Force ROTC High School Scholarship is available to incoming students at Colorado State University who enroll in the AFROTC program. You must be a U.S. citizen, have a minimum GPA of 3.0, and a minimum SAT composite of 1240 or ACT composite of 26 to be eligible for this award. Additionally, you must pass a medical exam and physical fitness assessment. If selected as a recipient, you agree to accept a commission as an Air Force officer and serve at least four years on active duty. This scholarship covers 100 percent of tuition and includes both a monthly living stipend and annual book stipend. more...

Alpaca Breeders Of The Rockies Scholarship
Annual award for graduate DVM student attending Colorado State University full-time, in third year of Veterinary Medicine. Applicant must have demonstrated interest in camelid medicine and surgery; be enrolled in Small Ruminant and Camelid Medicine Course (VM778D); have selected at least one additional senior rotation involving camelid medicine; show a desire and intention to pursue a veterinary position that provides camelid service in Rocky Mountain States (CO, NM and WY). Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Alton Cole Scholarship
The Alton Cole Scholarship is available to full-time fine arts majors at Adams State College. Incoming first-year students must have a minimum 25 ACT score and a minimum 3.5 GPA, while continuing students must have a minimum 3.25 GPA to be considered for this award. First preference will be given to speech and theater majors. more...

American Association Of University Women (Aauw) Cooperative House Scholarship Fund /Fort Collins Branch
*A junior or senior undergraduate (no previous bachelor’s degree) non-traditional female student. Non-traditional female student may be defined as: First generation earning a bachelor’s degree,Over 22 years of age,Parent,Prior military service,Widowed,Medical condition that delayed schooling,or Under-represented field of study (for example, Science, Technology, Engineering or Math)
*Colorado resident
*Demonstrated financial need
*Minimum 3.0 GPA
*AAUW is a national organization promoting societal change, equity for women, education, & self-development over the life span
*Submit applications and official college transcript(s) to Colorado State University, Adult Learner & Veterans Services, 8033 Campus Delivery, Fort Collins, CO 80523. Official transcripts must be sealed, but do not need to be sent directly from your school.
*Drop off applications at Room 195, Lory Student Center (Adult Learner & Veterans Services)
*Previous recipients of an AAUW scholarship are not eligible to apply. more...

American Association Of University Women (Aauw) Educational Foundation Fellowships And Grants
*Multiple fellowships and grants to advance education & equality for women & girls of all ages, races, creeds, nationalities, & physical abilities; see web site for details of individual fellowships & grants.
*Largest source of funding in the world exclusively for graduate women.
*Scholars pursuing a vast spectrum of academic research; public school teachers promoting girls’ achievement in math, science, & technology; & community activists helping to improve the lives of women & girls through education.
*Funding also assists women at critical stages of their careers, as well as those preparing for professions underrepresented by women & women of color. Special funding available for a college/university scholar-in-residence to research issues of gender & equity.
*Applicants must demonstrate scholarly or professional excellence as described in the program criteria.
*Preference is given to women whose civic, community, or professional work shows a commitment to advancing the lives of women & girls.
*Multiple application deadlines; see web site above for specific dates, etc.
*To obtain guidelines, see web site, address, & phone numbers.
*Applicants are not required to be members of AAUW or contributors to the AAUW Educational Foundation. more...

American Association Of University Women (Aauw), Durango Branch, Post High School Scholarship
Scholarship for female residents of La Plata, San Juan, Archuleta, Montezuma or San Miguel counties, Colorado who are non-traditional students attending Fort Lewis College. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA, at least 30 credit hours, be a minimum of 25 years of age, and file the FAFSA. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

American Association Of Woodturners Scholarship
1) Majoring in Engineering and Technology Education or its equivalent 2) Express special interest in teaching wood technology 3) Maintain cumulative 2.5 GPA or higher more...

American Indian Scholars Rocky Mountain Chamber
*Must be an American Indian
*Must be a Colorado Resident
*Must have a GPA of 2.5 or higher
*Must complete application form
*Must send a transcript
*Must send most current tax return
*Must include two recommendations
*Must include an essay describing your chosen field of study, your educational goals, career goals and involvement in the Indian community more...

American Indian Services Scholarship
*Enrollment in an accredited university, college, junior college or technical school
*Undergraduate student with no more than 150 semester hours or 210 quarter credits at the time of application
*Minimum cum. GPA of 2.25
*Full-time and part-time students; excluding non-credit courses. Full-time status is 12+ credits (semester) & 6+ credits (term). Part-time status is 6+ credits (semester) & 3+ credits (term)
*Proof of Indian heritage—these can be copies of the original: Certificate of Indian Blood; other official document; parent/grandparent official document
*Must turn in a tuition billing statement for the semester he/she is applying for. Statement needs to include number of credit hours, full-time/part-time status, semester attending, year in school, & tuition billing amount for the semester/term for which you are applying
*Must turn in a current official transcript. High school transcripts accepted only for students applying for their first semester of college

Award IV Nov 15th Classes starting Jan

American Psychological Foundation (Apf)
*Multiple scholarships, grants, & awards for advancing the science & practice of psychology for the understanding of behavior & benefit of human welfare
*APF promotes the practice & science of psychology through scholarships that encourage the best & brightest, through research grants & innovative programs in psychology that shed light on some of society’s most pressing concerns, & through awards that inspire continued excellence among practitioners, clinicians, & researchers
*See web site for specifics of scholarships, grants, fellowships, & awards, including amounts, criteria, application process, due dates (some have above dates; one add’l fellowship has a November 15th deadline; one grant accepts applications on an ongoing basis), & general information
*Unless otherwise indicated on applications APAGS scholarship must be received by May 16.

Americorps
U.S. citizens, nationals, or lawful permanent residents aged 17 or older
*Members serve full- or part-time over a 10- to 12-month period
*Full-time members receive an education award of $4,725 to pay for college, graduate school, or to pay back student loans
*Members also receive health insurance, training, & student loan deferment
*About half of the members also receive a modest annual living allowance of about $9,300 along with health insurance
*Members who serve part-time receive a partial education award
*AmeriCorps is a network of national service programs that engage more than 50,000 Americans each year in intensive service to meet critical needs in education, public safety, health, & the environment
*AmeriCorps members serve through more than 2,100 nonprofits, public agencies, & faith-based organizations. They tutor & mentor youth, build affordable housing, teach computer skills, clean parks & streams, run after-school programs, & help communities respond to disasters
*AmeriCorpsState & National: Organizations receiving grants are responsible for recruiting, selecting, & supervising AmeriCorps members. AmeriCorps grantees include national groups like Habitat for Humanity, the American Red Cross, and Boys & Girls Clubs, as well as many small faith-based & community organizations
*AmeriCorps*VISTA: Members serve full-time for a year in nonprofits, public agencies & faithbased groups throughout the country, working to fight illiteracy, improve health services, create business, increase housing opportunities, or bridge the digital divide. See www.americorps.gov for more details
*AmeriCorps*NCCC: A 10-month, full-time residential program for men & women between the ages of 18 & 24; combines the best practices of civilian service with the best aspects of military service, including leadership & team building. Priority is given to projects in public safety, public health, & disaster relief. See www.americorps.gov for more details
AmeriCorps Promise Fellows: A leadership cadre of committed, talented individuals who dedicate a year of their lives to building a better future for children & youth. Special partnership between AmeriCorps & America’s Promise—the Alliance for Youth; spearheading community efforts to provide young people with the Five Promises identified at the Presidents’ Summit for America’s Future. See www.americorps.gov
*AmeriCorps Education Awards are awarded after a member successfully completes the required term of service for their program. AmeriCorpsVISTA members may choose to receive a cash payment of $100 per month of service instead of the education award. If they’re a member of any other AmeriCorps program, they will be eligible only for the education award. After successfully completing one full-time term of service (at least 1,700 hours over one year or less), member is eligible for $4,725. After successfully completing one part-time term of service (at least 900 hours over 2 years or less), member is eligible for $2,362.50. Short-term program, such as a summer program, is eligible for a “reduced part-time” award—usually $1,000 or less. Can receive up to two education awards. Questions about education award, call 1-888-507-5962. See www.americorps.gov more...

Apartment List Scholarship
Any legal U.S. resident in high school or college at least eighteen (18) years old who will be attending an accredited university or college in Fall 2015 is eligible to apply.
To apply, please submit an application that includes answers to the following questions:
•What have you done that exemplifies one (or more) of Apartment List’s core values?
•What is most important to you when choosing a place to call “home”?
Please submit through the Apartment List Scholarship Application Form online.
Outstanding students who exemplify one or more of Apartment List’s core values:
•Bold While Pragmatic
•Endlessly Helpful
•Making an Impact
•Driven by Data
•Succeeding Together
•Forever Learning
Complete Application on website
Deadlines
Spring: March 1
Summer: June 1
Fall: September 1
Winter: December 1 more...

Army Health Professionals Scholarship Program
*The HPSP is available for students pursuing advanced degrees in medicine, dentistry, veterinary science, psychiatric nursing, optometry or psychology. To qualify for the Health Professions Scholarship Program, you must
*Be a U.S. citizen with a baccalaureate degree from an accredited school
*Be enrolled in (or have a letter or acceptance from) an accredited graduate program in the U.S. or Puerto Rico (varies by specialty)
*Maintain full-time student status during the length of the program
*Qualify as a commissioned officer in the United States Army Reserve
*YOUR OBLIGATION Your active duty service obligation to the U.S. Army is one year of service for every year you receive the scholarship. Your minimum obligation depends on your health care field. For example, the minimum obligation for medical students is two years. Dental, psychology, optometry and veterinary students are obligated to serve no fewer than three years. There is an additional obligation for residency and fellowship training.
See website for additional information. more...

Army Rotc Four Year Scholarsip
*Two-, three-, and four-year scholarship options based on the time remaining to complete your degree
*Full-tuition scholarships Options for room and board in place of tuition, if you qualify Additional allowances for books and fees
*The high school Four-Year Scholarship is for high school students planning on attending a four-year college program. Contact your high school academic advisor or campus Military Science department for more information.
*Be a U.S. citizen
*Be between the ages of 17 and 26
*Have a high school GPA of at least 2.50
*Have a high school diploma or equivalent
*Score a minimum of 920 on the SAT (math/verbal) or 19 on the ACT (excluding the required writing test scores)
*Meet physcial standards
*Agree to accept a commission and serve in the Army on Active Duty or in a Reserve Component (Army Reserve or Army National Guard)
*An eight-year service commitment with the Army. Serve full time in the Army for four years and four years with the Individual Ready Reserve (IRR). Selected Cadets may choose to serve part time in the Army Reserve or Army National Guard while pursuing a civilian career more...

Asian/Pacific Islanders For Professional And Community Advancement (Apca)/At &T
All full-time graduating high school seniors in good academic standing (minimum unweighted GPA 3.40 on 4-point scale), of any ethnic or cultural background, who plans to attend an accredited college or university (2-year and 4-year) in Fall 2015.
Applicants who are United States citizens or permanent residents of the United States.
Applicants who are residents of one of the following states or metropolitan area where we currently have APCA chapters: Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey, Ohio, Texas, Washington, Wisconsin, and the Washington, D.C. Metropolitan Area (Washington D.C., Maryland, and Virginia).
If you have any questions regarding the APCA scholarship program, visit our FAQ page, send email to scholarship@apca-att.org or call Mr. Yakun Gao (Scholarship Program Chair) at 425-633-4935. more...

Associates In Family Medicine Scholarship

Applicant must have high academic record, aptitude for engineering, moral character, leadership potiential, financial need, register for 14 credits of the standard engineering curricula and maintain a 3.0 CGPA. Colorado Education & Training Voucher (Etv) Program
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS
You must be a current or former foster student who:
Is currently in out-of-home care, 15 up to 18 years of age, and who has been in out-of-home care a minimum of six months;
OR
Is age 16 to 21 who meets requirements for Relative Guardianship Assistance and entered Relative Guardianship Assistance on or after age 16;
OR
Is age 16 to 21 who meets requirements for Adoption Assistance andentered Adoption Assistance on or after age 16;
OR
Is age 18 to 21 who was in out-of-home care on your 18th birthday.
You must be a U.S. citizen or qualified non-citizen.
Your personal assets (bank account, car, home, etc.) are worth less than $10,000.
You must be at least 17 but younger than 21 to apply for the first time. You may reapply for ETV funds, if you have a current grant, up to the age of 23.
You must have been accepted into or be enrolled in a degree, certificate or other accredited program at a college, university, technical, vocational school. To remain eligible for ETV funding, you must show progress toward a degree or certificate.
For more information, please call 800-585-6118×2 or email co@statevoucher.org . Our fax number is 855-773-8305.
Please apply for the 15-16 school year after July 1, 2015. more...

Applicants must have good academic standing, financial need and demonstrate interest in Environment Health issues. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

1) Preference given to entering freshmen and transfers from junior colleges, colleges, and universities within Colorado 2) Open to all majors in the College of Agricultural Sciences 3) Colorado resident 4) Recipients shall be immediate family members of a current Colorado Farm Bureau member 5) Maintain good scholastic standing – GPA of 2.5 or above more...

Colorado Farm Bureau Scholarship
Scholarship for Colorado residents who are undergraduate students admitted to Colorado State University full-time, enrolled in the College of Agricultural Sciences, and whose parents or legal guardians are current Colorado Farm Bureau members and have been for at least one year. Student must be a U.S. citizen. Preference is given to incoming freshmen and transfer students from junior colleges, colleges and universities within the state of Colorado. Student must maintain a good scholastic standing (2.5 GPA or above). Admissions application to the College of Agricultural Sciences is reviewed for all scholarships. more...

Colorado Power Council Scholarship
Scholarship for Colorado residents who are incoming freshmen accepted to Colorado State University full-time, enrolled in the College of Agricultural Sciences, Business, Engineering, Natural Resources or Natural Sciences. Number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Colorado Professional Golfers Association Foundation Turf Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Colorado State University, majoring in Horticulture with an interest in Landscape Management or Landscape Design. Selection is based on financial need. Consideration shall be given to freshmen and transfer students. Qualified candidates list sent to donor for final selection. Renewable. more...

Colorado Roofing Association Scholarship

Colorado Seed Industry Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior attending Colorado State University, majoring in one of the programs involved in Seed Science option or having work experience in the Seed Industry. Applicant must maintain a 2.5 GPA. Selection is based on financial need and interest in a career in the Seed Industry. more...

Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students (freshmen ineligible) attending Fort Lewis College who are majoring in Accounting. Applicants must have completed one intermediate accounting course. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Science. Applicants must participate in the Colorado State Science Fair and submit a winning project. Due date varies. more...

Scholarship for female undergraduate students attending Colorado State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and have financial need. Due date varies. more...

Colorado Transfer Scholarship
Scholarship for Colorado residents who are transfer students from a Colorado community or junior college enrolling at Fort Lewis College. Applicants must have a minimum of 24 transfer credits. Award amount coves one-half of in-state tuition. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

You must be interested in plaintiff's personal injury work, exhibit potential for success in trial advocacy and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Applicants must have graduated from a Colorado high school, have financial need, good academic performance, clinical proficiency, and leadership ability. Selection is based on students academic achievement. Recipient must have active membership in the Colorado State University Student Subunit of AFS. Cu Boulder Arts & Humanities Achievement Scholarship
The CU Boulder Arts & Humanities Achievement Scholarship is available to incoming freshman undergraduate students at the University of Colorado-Boulder who are non-residents. To be considered for this renewable award, you must have a minimum weighted GPA of 3.85. Additionally, you must major in one of the following areas: Art History, Asian Studies, Chinese, Classics, Dance, English, Cinema Studies and Moving Image Arts, French, German Studies, History, Humanities, Italian, Japanese, Jewish Studies, Philosophy, Religious Studies, Russian Studies, Spanish, Art Practices, or Theatre. Selection is based on academic merit, personal background, service/employment activities, and responsibilities. more...

The CU Boulder Arts & Humanities Gold Scholarship is available to incoming freshman undergraduate students at the University of Colorado-Boulder. To be considered for this renewable award, you must have a minimum weighted GPA of 3.85 and be a Colorado resident. Additionally, you must major in one of the following areas: Art History, Asian Studies, Chinese, Classics, Dance, English, Cinema Studies and Moving Image Arts, French, German Studies, History, Humanities, Italian, Japanese, Jewish Studies, Philosophy, Religious Studies, Russian Studies, Spanish, Art Practices, or Theatre. Selection is based on academic merit, personal background, service/employment activities, and responsibilities. more...

Daniels Fund Scholarship Program
Each year, 30% of the Daniels Funds charitable allocations are made through the Daniels Fund Scholarship Program, which consists of the Daniels Scholarship and the Daniels Opportunity Scholarship.
*Each spring, Daniels Scholarships are awarded to graduating high school seniors allowing them to attend any two- or four-year accredited college or university in the United States with an intention to complete a bachelor’s degree.
*Daniels Opportunity Scholarships are distributed to two- and four-year colleges and universities throughout our four states that provide scholarships to support non-traditional students including adults entering or returning to college; students from alternative schools, juvenile justice facilities and youth offender programs; GED recipients, former foster care youth, returning military, and emergency service providers.
See website for more information. more...

Denver Scholarship Foundation
*Graduate from a participating Denver Public High School in 2015 or later. Certain enrollment periods apply. See www.denverscholarship.org for details.
*Must be a US Citizen, permanent resident, or an eligible non-citizen for federal financial aid.
*Complete and submit the Free Application for Federal Student Aid by March 15 at www.fafsa.ed.gov.
*Complete and submit the Denver Scholarship Foundation Scholarship Application at www.denverscholarship.org by April 1.
*Further details and instructions are available at www.denverscholarship.org. more...

Student should address the topic of social responsibility in their essay and explain how it fits into career goals. more...

Discover Scholarship Program
*High school junior as of September 2009(applying on-line use Acess Key DISC)
*Cumulative grade point average for the 9th and 10th grade years only of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale
*Enrolled in an accredited public or private high school in the U.S. or the District of Columbia
*Scholarships may be used for any type of education and/or training beyond high school, including: certification or license; trade or technical school; or two- or four-year colleges and universities
*Two levels of Tribute Award scholarships: State (& District of Columbia) Scholarships: up to 9 awards of $2,500 each; National Scholarships: up to 9 awards of $25,000 each
*Application materials are sent to high schools in August for the next year’s awards & are available online at the above web site beginning in September before the next year’s awards
*Application deadline is early January for the upcoming academic year more...

Dissertation Award In Chemistry
1) Recent graduate (defended the dissertation or completed the degree in the calendar year immediately preceding the year in which the award is given; dissertations may only be nominated once) of the doctoral program in the Department of Chemistry at CSU whose primary advisor is a regular member of the Chemistry faculty at CSU 2) Have presented important results and interpretation from exceptional research in their well-written dissertation that focuses on significant problems in the chemical sciences 3) Dissertations reflecting the broad scope and diversity of the chemical sciences are particularly desirable more...

Distinguished Scholars Awards
Scholarship for incoming freshmen admitted to the Colorado State University full-time. Selection based on transcripts and test scores. Student must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident and file a FAFSA application. Candidates must have a minimum 3.8 GPA and an ACT score of 28 or SAT of 1240. Additional $2,000 awarded in junior year for participation in an approved Study Abroad Program. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Diy Instructional Video Scholarship Contest
*This scholarship is designed for high school seniors who have been or are accepted into a college, university, or trade school and for current college students
*We are asking you to create an instructional do-it-yourself (DIY) video to inform on some household repair task. This could be as simple as changing a light bulb and as complex as cleaning a dryer vent! Videos may be narrative or technical style, as long as the instructions are clear and concise to the viewer.
*See website for addtional information more...

Dottie Roberts Foundation Publishing Scholarships
women, age 16-25
*Colorado residents
*enrolled as a full-time student in a college or university
*in need of financial support in order to be able to attend college or university
*with a demonstrated record of interest in the publication of printed material through such activities as work on the school newspaper, yearbook, or other magazine or printed publication
*Applications for these scholarships must include:
*a curriculum vitae or resume, not to exceed two pages in length
*a personal statement, not to exceed 500 words
*a scanned copy of the most recent official academic transcript of college or university coursework bearing the institution’s seal; high-school transcript acceptable if the student has not yet begun college-level work
*a copy of the federal Student Aid Report (SAR), documenting financial need, or equivalent
*up to three letters of recommendation, including at least one from the students academic advisor, that address the quality of the candidate*s academic work and interest in the publication of print materials more...

Dr. John U Trefny Honor Program Application
The Honors Program at RRCC is an application-based, academic program open to all students. This is an “early decision” round of applications (3/7-5/1) for students who will be attending RRCC next academic year. The Honors program focuses on connecting your studies to real-world wicked problems. Students interested in pursuing a career in STEM are particularly encouraged to apply, but the program serves all majors and programs. The Honors Program Theme for the 2022-23 Cohort will focus on one the UN Sustainability Goals . Students accepted into the program will be participating in Honors coursework as well as many activities outside of the classroom and will receive an Honors scholarship. For more information about the program and its requirements, please visit our website at http://www.rrcc.edu/honors. You must be accepted as an RRCC student to apply to this program. Please complete the entire application and reference requests. Honors applications will be evaluated on a combination of academic, creative and experiential engagement criteria.
Required registration and scholarships for HNR 100 in the Fall:
Upon acceptance, all Honors students will register for the Honors Seminar course in the fall semester. HNR 100 is a required, late-start, one credit course that will be offered on Wednesdays or Fridays, starting 9/21/22. Honors students will also be attending a retreat tentatively scheduled for the first weekend in October each Fall (cost covered through the program). Also upon acceptance, all Honors students will be awarded scholarships ($600 first semester). You will receive a letter stating the scholarship award amount each semester as long as eligibility requirements are met. more...

Dream Award Scholarship America
*Be U.S. citizens, U.S. permanent resident (holders of a Permanent Resident Card), or individuals granted deferred action status under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals Program (DACA).
*Have received a high school diploma or the equivalent from a U.S. school, by September, 2014
*Have completed or expect to successfully complete a minimum of one full year of postsecondary education by June 2015.
*Plan to enroll in full time undergraduate study at the sophomore year level or higher at an accredited two or four year college, university or vocational-technical school in the United States for the entire 2015-16 academic year.
*Have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale (or its equivalent). Demonstrate financial need. more...

Dutchcrafters Amish Furniture Heritage Scholarship
*Enrolled or accepted for enrollment as a full-time student at an accredited 4-year undergraduate institution located in the United States of America.
*Be a U.S. citizen or maintain legal residency within the United States.
*Have achieved a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
*Must have applied for federal financial aid (FAFSA) in 2013.
*Excluded from consideration are employees and relatives of employees of JMX USA, the company that owns DutchCrafters.
*Students from all disciplines and fields of study are invited to apply. Scholarship recipients are selected based on the following factors: 1) Academic achievement and financial need 2) GPA of 3.0 or higher 3) The essay component of the application
*Download application on-line more...

Education And Training Voucher Program
You must be a current or former foster student who:
Is currently in out-of-home care, 15 up to 18 years of age, and who has been in out-of-home care a minimum of six months;
OR
Is age 16 to 21 who meets requirements for Relative Guardianship Assistance and entered Relative Guardianship Assistance on or after age 16;
OR
Is age 16 to 21 who meets requirements for Adoption Assistance andentered Adoption Assistance on or after age 16;
OR
Is age 18 to 21 who was in out-of-home care on your 18th birthday.
You must be a U.S. citizen or qualified non-citizen.
Your personal assets (bank account, car, home, etc.) are worth less than $10,000.
You must be at least 17 but younger than 21 to apply for the first time. You may reapply for ETV funds, if you have a current grant, up to the age of 23.
You must have been accepted into or be enrolled in a degree, certificate or other accredited program at a college, university, technical, vocational school. To remain eligible for ETV funding, you must show progress toward a degree or certificate.
For more information, please call 800-585-6118×2 or email co@statevoucher.org . Our fax number is 855-773-8305. more...

Elks National Foundation Scholarships
*All applications must be submitted to the closest elks lodge to the student’s home address by the deadline date above. See web site above to find out the elks lodge nearest you. Try searching using only the first three digits of your zip code. The lodge does not have to be located in the city where you live. Applications sent to the Elks National Foundation may be disqualified due to missing the filing deadline with the lodge.
*Any high school senior who is a citizen of the U.S.; college students are not eligible to apply; resident alien status does not qualify
*Need not be related to a member of the Elks
*Financial need, leadership, & scholarship
*Enrollment in an accredited U.S. college or university
*Most Valuable Student Scholarships are for students pursuing a four-year degree, on a full-time basis (minimum of 12 semester hours)
*Applications also available online at www.elks.org/enf/scholars/mvs.cfm, or by sending a self-addressed, stamped envelope to the Foundation at the above address

Families Of Freedom Scholarship Fund
*Dependent children or spouses of persons who were killed or are permanently disabled as a result of the terrorist attacks in the United States on Tuesday, September 11, 2001
*Must be students who plan to enroll in or are already enrolled in a course of study at an accredited two- or four-year college, university, or vocational-technical school based in the United States
*Must be financially needy. Financial need is determined by what a family can afford compared to the cost of the postsecondary institution
*Individual education assistance amounts will be determined based on funds available & financial need
*Depending on total funding available, education assistance may be renewable for up to 3 years for undergraduate study
*Must achieve satisfactory academic progress
*Starting date of program was January 2002; no deadline listed
*May apply for education assistance as seniors in high school or in following years
*Questions: 1-877-862-0136 & ask for the Families of Freedom Scholarship Fund program manager, or e-mail (above)
*May also visit www.scholarships911.org.org more...

Ford Foundation Diversity Fellowships
*Ford Foundation Diversity Fellowships are designed to increase the diversity of the nation’s college and university faculties by increasing their ethnic and racial diversity, to maximize the educational benefits of diversity, and to increase the number of professors who can and will use diversity as a resource for enriching the education of all students.
*U.S. citizen or national planning a career in teaching and research at the college or university level.
*Three separate fellowships for minorities: Ford Foundation Predoctoral Fellowships for Minorities, Ford Foundation Dissertation Fellowships for Minorities, & Ford Foundation Postdoctoral Fellowships for Minorities
*Predoctoral: Approximately 40; $20,000 per year for up to three years
*Dissertation: Approximately 20; $21,000 for one year
*Postdoctoral: Approximately 18; $40,000 for one year
*Application deadline dependent on fellowship.
*All awardees have expenses paid to attend 1 Conference of Ford Fellows.
*See web site for complete eligibility information.
*Web-based applications may be filled out and submitted on-line. more...

Foreclosure.Com College Scholarship Contest
*open only to those legal residents of the fifty United States, the U.S. Territories, the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico
*who are thirteen (13)years of age or older at the time of application and who are currently enrolled in a U.S. accredited, post-secondary institution of higher learning (college, university, or trade school)
*Your written response must be written in English, with correct spelling and grammar, and it must not exceed twothousand (2,000) words. No substitutions of new drafts or corrected pages will be accepted once you have submitted your original manuscript.
*All applications and manuscripts become the property of the Sponsor and will not be returned.
*By submitting an application, you fully and unconditionally accept and agree to these official rules and the decisions of the Sponsor, which are final and binding.
*See website for 2014 Essay Topic more...

*The dependent son or daughter of a U.S. Soldier, Sailor, Airman, Guardsman or Marine who has become permanently disabled as a result of an operational mission or training accident

*Currently in their senior year of high school, a high school graduate or a currently enrolled full time undergraduate student. more...

Friends Of Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Inc
*Be an enrolled member of the Navajo or Hopi Nation

*Have declared a major or special degree program

Gas Processors Association Rocky Mountain Chapter Scholarship
The Rocky Mountain Chapter of the Gas Processors Association is pleased to announce plans to award multiple scholarships between $500 and $3,000, which continues our Scholarship Program for the twelfth year in a row.
*The Chapter has established specific guidelines for selecting recipients of the Rocky Mountain GPA scholarships. These guidelines are that a student:
*has a sincere financial need
*The student has demonstrated a strong interest in the Oil and Gas Processing Industry.
*The student is maintaining a 2.8 or better Grade Point Average (4.0 scale).
*is working to aid in his or her own education
*The student has reached the third year at their respective University in the undergraduate program.
*submits an essay to the Scholarship Committee addressing these issues.
*Potential candidates must submit an essay addressing their interest in the Oil and Gas Processing Industry and complete an application. The essay (two page maximum) should be written to focus on the candidates interest in the oil and gas processing industry and how the candidate expects to use their degree in this industry.
The Scholarship Committee will review the candidates applications and essays and will make a final decision in mid October. more...

Gates Millennium Scholars Award
*African-American, American Indian/Alaska Native, Asian/Pacific American, or Hispanic citizens/permanent residents of the United States
*American Indian/Alaska Native nominees must provide tribal enrollment information or proof of descendancy
*Must have cumulative GPA of 3.3 on 4.0 scale
*Accepted into or enrolled full-time in accredited college or university
*Have demonstrated significant financial need as defined by the Federal needs analysis formula (FAFSA); award is for tuition, fees, books, & living expenses in an amount to be calculated by the Gates Millennium Scholars based on financial need
*Have demonstrated leadership commitment through participation in community service, extracurricular activities or other activities that reflect leadership abilities
*High school seniors & undergraduate students are unrestricted in terms of major or area of study; however, nominators should consider nominee’s academic performance in mathematics, science, & education courses, commitment to academic study, involvement in community service, career goal, & potential for leadership
*Graduate students must have been accepted into or be enrolled in a degree program in engineering, mathematics, science, education, or library science. Nomimators should consider overall academic performance in above named areas, involvement in community service, participation in leadership activities, & career goals
*Nominators must complete the nomination form & provide a nomination letter on personal stationery (do not use institution/organization stationery). They must also assist the nominee in completing the Nominee Personal Information Form
*Nomination Packet: completed Nomination Form with Nomination Letter; Nominee Personal Information Form; Nominee Personal Statement (essay); official high school, college, and/or graduate school transcript(s); Recommendation Form with Recommendation Letter; & information concerning tribal enrollment, if any, or descendancy (for American Indians/Alaska Natives)
*Administering Agencies: American Indian Graduate Center / 4520 Montgomery Blvd. N.E., Ste. 1-B / Albuquerque, NM 87109-1291 / Phone: (505)884-7007
*Hispanic Scholarship Fund / Attn: Cathy Makunga, Senior Program Officer / 44 Montgomery St., Suite 600 / San Francisco, CA 94104 / Phone: (800)944-9627 or (415)217-5040; Fax: (415)217-5047; Web Site: www.hsf.net
*Organization of Chinese Americans / Attn: Daphne Kwok / 1001 Connecticut Ave. NW, Suite 601 / Washington, DC 20036 / Phone: (202)530-8894
*United Negro College Fund / P.O. Box 10444 / Fairfax, VA 22031-8044 / Phone: (800)944-9627 or (703)205-2080; Web Site: www/gmsp.org more...

George H. Nofer Scholarship For Law And Public Policy
Applicant uses spoken language as the primary mode of communication
*Applicant has a pre-lingual hearing loss (diagnosed prior to the fourth birthday).
*Applicants hearing loss is bilateral and in the moderately severe to profound range. Applicants must have an unaided Pure-Tone Average (PTA) of 60dB or greater in the better hearing ear in the speech frequencies of 500, 1000 and 2000 Hz. Individuals with cochlear implants meet this eligibility requirement. Unilateral (one-sided) hearing loss does not qualify.
*Applicant has been accepted at or is enrolled in an accredited law school or masters/doctoral program in public policy or public administration as a full-time graduate student for the 2014-2015 academic year. more...

Government Finance Professional Development Scholarship By Gfoa
eligibility requirements:
- Employed at least two years by one or more state or local governments.
- Recommendation by your employer.
- Currently a part-time student in a graduate program in public administration, (governmental) accounting, finance, economics, or
business administration that prepares students for careers in state and local government finance and expecting to be enrolled in the spring 2016 semester (including spring 2016 graduates).
- Baccalaureate degree or its equivalent.
- Citizen or permanent resident of the United States or Canada.
- Recommendation by your academic advisor or dean of the graduate program.
- Student has not been a past winner of a scholarship program administered by the Government Finance Officers Association of the United States and Canada.
Criteria for scholarship Award:
- Statement of proposed career plan in state and local government finance and proposed plan of graduate study.
- Plans to pursue a career in state or local government finance.
- Past academic record and work experience.
- Strength of past coursework and present plan of study as it relates to a career in the public sector.
- Letters of recommendation from your employer, your academic advisor or dean of the graduate program, and others.
- Undergraduate and graduate grade point averages.
Application:
Applicants must submit the following documents for consideration by the scholarship selection committee:
- Application form.
- Statement describing your experience working for a state, local government, or other special-purpose government entity, your
proposed plan of study and how it will help your career in the public sector.
- Undergraduate and graduate grade transcripts.
- Résumé.
- Employer’s letter of recommendation.
- Academic advisor’s or dean’s letter of recommendation, other letters of recommendation (optional)
All of the above items are to be submitted in a single envelope, postmarked no later than February 19,2016 to:
Government Finance Officers Association, Scholarship Committee,
203 North LaSalle Street, Suite 2700, Chicago, Illinois 60601-1210
For additional information, e-mail Robert Kotchen at the Government Finance Officers Association, rkotchen@gfoa.org, or call 312/977-9700. more...

Helen Kroeger Faris Scholarship
Scholarship for residents who lived within the drainage area of the San Juan or Dolores River Basins in Colorado or New Mexico at the time of high school graduation and are full-time undergraduate students attending Fort Lewis College. Freshmen must have a minimum 2.0 GPA; sophomores a 2.5 GPA; juniors a 2.75 GPA; and seniors a 3.0 GPA. Award amount may cover in-state tuition. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Hispanic Scholarship Fund
*Be of Hispanic heritage (one parent fully Hispanic or each parent half Hispanic)
*Be a U.S. citizen or legal permanent resident with permanent resident card or passport stamped I-551 (not expired)
*Must apply for federal financial aid using the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
*Have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
*Download the application materials at www.hsf.net
*Be pursuing or plan to pursuing your first undergraduate degree.
*Scholarship deadlines on website. more...

Howard Hughes Medical Institute Research Training Fellowship For Medical Students
*Must pursue full-time study toward a Ph.D. or an Sc.D. degree in selected biological science.
*Fellowships support training in fundamental research—toward understanding basic biological processes or disease mechanisms—in the following fields: biochemistry, bioinformatics, biophysics, biostatistics, cell biology, developmental biology, epidemiology, genetics, immunology, mathematical & computational biology, microbiology, molecular biology, neuroscience, pharmacology, physiology, structural biology, or virology
*In general, study must be in a biological sciences dept., although study in chemistry, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, or other related departments is allowed if the dept. provides ample opportuniity for formal study in biological sciences. Exceptions are reviewed on an individual basis
*At the time of application, may be college seniors, college graduates with no or limited postbaccalaureate graduate study in the biological sciences, or first-year graduate students. Intended for students who have completed less than one year of graduate study toward an M.S., a Ph.D., or an Sc.D. degree in the biological sciences. Students who hold or are pursuing medical or dental degrees (M.D., D.O., D.V.M., D.D.S.) may also be eligible to apply for fellowship support for study toward a Ph.D. or an Sc.D.
*Open to both U.S. citizens and foreign citizens. Students with U.S. citizenship may take the fellowship abroad. Non-U.S. citizens must study in the United States
*Annual stipend of $21,000, an annual fellow’s allowance of $2,500, & an annual institutional allowance of $13,500. Fellowship award is for 5 years
*Availability of support after the first year of a fellowship award is contingent on the fellowship institution’s annual certification to HHMI that the fellow is making satisfactory academic progress. Except for an approved leave of absence, fellows must use the fellowship within 5 successive years. Fellows must engage in their Ph.D. or Sc.D. studies full-time for 12 months of each fellowship year, & the fellowship years must be consecutive
*Fellows are not permitted to supplement the stipend by private employment or consulting work or to receive funds from another external fellowship, scholarship, or similar award. Fellowship institution may supplement the stipend in accordance with its usual policy for comparable graduate students more...

Iapd Charitable Foundation Scholarship
*A student enrolled in a full-time undergraduate degree or graduate degree program majoring in polymer sciences. (Full-time = minimum 12 credit hours/semester.
*Students at the undergraduate or graduate level must be EITHER an employee or a child of an employee of an IAPD member company
*Candidates must have a minimum of a 2.5 cumulative GPA based on a 4.0 scale.
*College-bound high school seniors are eligible to apply for the IAPD Scholarship.
*Students are ranked based on academic achievement, extracurricular activities and financial need.
*Applications and all supporting materials must be submitted electronically to Jean McClure. All scholarships are paid directly to the school, not to the student. more...

Ima Scholarship Program
*Memorial Education Fund(MFE)Scholarships range from $1000 to $2500. Stuart Cameron and Margaret McCloud Memorial (SCMS) $5000, one of the MEF Students from the pool of applicants will receive the SCMS.
*Application plus following materials must accompany applicaiton. on-page resume, offical university transcripts, two recommendations, and two page written statement from the candidate.
*Two page written statement should experss the following: Applicants reason for appling for the scholarship, reasons he/she deserve the award, specific contributions to IMA, Ideas on how he/she will promote awareness and increase memebership adn cerification with in IMA, and Applicant’s career goals and objectives.
*Full adn part-time (must carry at least six credits per semester)student are encouraged to apply. Note: SCMS Scholarship requres student must carry 12 credits per semester.
*Scholarships are awared to students who are physically located in the U.S. adn Puerto Rico, studing at regionally accredited institutions.
*Applicants must be an IMA Student Member, Membership # must be included on the application form.
*Min 3.0 GPA. more...

Insureon Scholarship Program
Upcoming Opportunities
In 2015, you’ll have two more chances to win a $2,500 scholarship. Check out our upcoming contest topics for an idea of what we’ll be looking for all year…
This on opened May 4. Contest closing July 31: Write about how a summer job at or as a small business inspired you.
Share:
In 500 – 750 words, tell about how a summer job at or as a small business inspired you.
Submit:
Complete the application form and submit your essay to be eligible to win.
Win:
Two winners will earn a $2,500 scholarship toward their educational expenses.
Contest closing December 1: Write about how you’ve given back to your community through a small business. more...

Kush Arora Criminal Justice Reform Scholarship
Eligibility and Selection Criteria:
•The scholarship program is available to undergraduate, graduate, and law school students as well as incoming college freshmen.
•The candidate must be in good academic standing with at least a 3.0 minimum cumulative GPA.
Application Requirements:
The Kush Arora Criminal Justice Scholarship program invites all candidates who meet the aforementioned criteria to apply. Applicants will be evaluated based on the following:
•Applicants must submit a 1,000-word essay responding to one of the following prompts (they will be judged on the best-reasoned response, not on the position of the applicant): ◦Provide a well-reasoned argument about whether a specific policy in the criminal justice system (your choice) is unjust and requires reform, or is just and should stay the same.
•Applicants must also submit a current academic transcript from the applicant’s school, or an academic transcript of the applicant’s most recent school (including the applicantssions may be addressed to:
Kush Arora Federal Criminal Justice Reform Scholarship
Attn: Firm Administrator
409 7th St NW
Suite 210
Washington, DC 20004
Fax: (202) 664-1331
To be considered eligible for this scholarship, interested students must submit a completed application along with the above requirements by fax or mail no later than July 1, 2016. The winner will be notified during the summer of 2016.
For questions, please email: info@maryland-criminallawyer.com. more...

La Tutors Innovation In Education Scholarship
Criteria
Must currently be enrolled as a high school or college/university student within the United States or Canada.
Must have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 (or the equivalent).
Must be a citizen of, permanent resident of, or hold a valid student visa in the United States or Canada.
Must have designed an innovative project that makes a difference in the lives of others (This could be a website, series of blogs, an app, fundraising event, etc.)
Must submit an essay describing the goal of the particular project and provide supporting documentation.
The essay, idea, or creation must be the applicant’s original work.
All submissions must be uploaded no later than 11:59 pm PST on the 20th of each month. The submission window closes starting the 21st and will reopen on the 1st at 8:00am.
Complete application on website
Upload an essay, letter of recommendation, and photo of yourself before submitting the application by clicking the Upload Scholarship Documents button and uploading files all at once. All of the following documents must be included:
•Essay – The essay should describe the goal of the particular project and provide the link to access the content such as the blog, app, etc. (if applicable).
•Letter of Recommendation – The letter should evaluate the quality of the work.
•Your Photo – The photo should be one taken during project execution. more...

Latin American Educational Foundation Scholarship/Laef
*Colorado resident-determined by having a permanent address in Colorado
*Hispanic heritage and/or actively involved in the Hispanic community
Scholarship recipients are required to fulfill 10 hours of community service during year of funding at your college/university. Service provided at/for LAEF will qualify to satisfy this requirement and is strongly encouraged.
*Accepted to an accredited college, university, or vocational school
Scholarship is available to undergraduate and graduate students.
*Minimum 3.0 cumulative grade point average
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION MATERIALS:
Current Photo (optional);
2 Letters of Recommendation (recommender will upload online):
One from an educator (teacher, professor, advisor or administrator);
One from a community service organization, employer, coach, mentor, etc.;
Current High School or College Transcript;
One of the following (your most recent):
Federal Income Tax Return OR
W2s OR
2-3 paycheck stubs;
One of the following (high school applicants only):
ACT Score Report OR
SAT Score Report;
List of Extracurricular Activities;
Scholarship Essay 1:
Describe how your Hispanic heritage has influenced your life and shaped who you are. Discuss your involvement in the Hispanic Community (volunteerism, extracurricular activities, community service) and describe how and why this is meaningful for you and your community;
Scholarship Essay 2:
What has motivated you to pursue higher education? Describe your leadership experiences and your leadership potential, and talk about the challenges you have overcome and how they have affected your development. Tell us about your life interests and career and academic goals and how you anticipate achieving those goals. more...

Liko A'e Scholarship Native Hawaiian Scholarship Program
*Be Hawaiian, defined as a descendent of the aboriginal inhabitants of the Hawaiian Islands prior to 1778, as evidenced by original, certified birth records
*Be a United States citizen
*Have a high school diploma (or its equivalent)
*Be enrolled or accepted as a student in any degree-awarding program
*Be enrolled full-time or half time in a regionally accredited two- or four-year degree-granting institution of higher education
*Demonstrate financial need through submission of the 2014-2015 Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
*Satisfactorily meet the Liko A’e program’s academic requirements: a minimum grade point average, on the 4.0 scale, of 2.0 for undergraduates and 3.0 for graduate students
*Only EXISTING Liko A’e Scholars may apply for additional funds for Summer 2014. more...

Lilly Reintegration Scholarship
*Be diagnosed with schizophrenia, schizophreniform disorder, schizoaffective disorder, or bipolar disorder
*Be currently receiving medical treatment, including medications and psychiatric follow-up.
*Be actively involved in rehabilitative or reintegrative efforts, such as clubhouse membership, part-time work, volunteer efforts, or school enrollment.
*Complete and application package – obtained from the website – that includes an application form, essay, transcripts, recommendation forms from three references, and school financial requirements.
*Complete the FAFSA (not required for applicants seeking financial aid for high school or GED)
*Scholarships only available to U.S. citizens attending classes within the US.
*Eligible programs include: high school equivalency, trade or vocational school, associate degrees, bachelor degreees and graduate degrees.
*Be of the age of 18 years or older more...

Longmont United Hospital Foundation Scholarship/Loan
*The Longmont United Hospital Foundation has a limited number of merit based scholarships/loans available for those pursuing a career in the healthcare field. Scholarships/loans will be awarded based on scholastic and personal achievement without regard to financial need. Full tuition assistance may be awarded to applicants who qualify.
*Students who receive scholarships/loans will be required to apply at Longmont United Hospital for employment upon completion of their studies. If employment is not offered, then their will be no repayment required. Repayent of all funds received is required if: 1) a student fails to complete their studies or 2) does not apply at Longmont United Hospital or 3) does not accept employment with LUH and fulfill a two year work obligation after graduation. If repayment is required, then the scholarship/loan will be interest free up to two years. After the two year period, recipients will be required to pay back their scholarship/loan at an 8% interest rate.
*Applicants who wish to enter a healthcare profession that works in direct patient care in a hospital setting will be considered. Simply “majoring” in a healthcare field at an institution does not necessarily qualify for scholarship assistance. You must complete all required pre-requisite course work and be accepted into the actual healthcare school or program in your field of study before your application will be considered.
*Applications may be picked up at the address above. Applicants will be notified of awards no later than June 2014.
*Scholarship applications are available the first week in January and must be completed and returned to the Foundation no later than the last business day in March. more...

Lonnie Wright Scholarship
1) Full-time undergraduate student 2) Any college, any major, and any class level 3) Overall 2.7 GPA 4) Financial need 5) Preference for a student involved in community service and/or campus activities 6) Preference given to a student from an underrepresented population more...

Louis Stokes Health Scholars Program (Cbfc)
*Applicants must be U.S. citizens or legal U.S. residents who have a minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale
*Applicants must also be currently enrolled or planning to enroll in a full-time undergraduate course of study at an accredited two- or four-year college, university, or technical school.
*The anticipated degree must be in a subject that will lead to a career in a health field.
*The ideal candidate is a student at a two-year institution who plans to complete a four-year degree and seek work in an undeserved community.
*Additionally, the candidate will demonstrate financial need. Employees or immediate family members of United Health Group and its affiliates, CBC Members, the CBC Foundation staff, the CBC Foundation Board of Directors or the CBC Foundation Corporate Advisory Council are not eligible.
*A personal statement essay from the student (500-1,000 words) that addresses all four (4) of the topics listed on the application in one cohesive essay
*Two (2) letters of recommendation. One recommendation should come from a community or public service leader (i.e. church leader, community leader, volunteer organization). Email addresses will be requested of each recommender for electronic submission of the letter. Hard copy letters will not be accepted
*Copy of detailed Federal Student Aid Report (SAR); this report comes from the US Department of Education, not your institution
*One (1) page resume listing extracurricular activities, honors, employment, community service and special skills
*A recent photograph suitable for publication; i.e., a cap and gown picture, or other professional quality and professionally dressed photograph
*Graduating high school seniors must provide proof of enrollment into institution of study for 2014
*Official sealed transcripts from all institutions attended. Freshmen level students must also submit high school transcripts to be sent to: Louis Stokes Health Scholars Program Congressional Black Caucus Foundation, Inc. 1720 Massachusetts Ave, NW Washington, DC 20036 more...

Major General James Ursano Scholarship Program
*For dependent children, stepchildren or legally adopted children of Army Soldiers on active duty, retired, or deceased while on active duty or after retirement
*Registered in the Defense Eligibility Enrollment Reporting System (DEERS). You can check your status at 800/538-9552
*Must be unmarried for entire academic year
*Under the age of 23 for the entire academic year
*Must be enrolled, accepted, or pending acceptance as a full-time dependent student for the entire academic year in postsecondary educational institutions accredited by the U.S. Department of Education
*Must maintain at least a cumulative 2.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale
*Awards primarily based on finanical need
*Academic achievements & individual accomplishments are considered
*Scholarships awarded on an annual basis for up to a maxiumum of 4 years of undergraduate study
*Students must apply each year and application must be complete, accurate and contain all required documents and signatures when received.
*Scholarship funds may be used to assist with tuition, fees, books, supplies, and room & board (on or off campus)
*Email all documentation to scholarships@aerhq.org. All documents must be scanned in a PDF (Portable Document Format) file, and MUST be legible. Any parts cut off due to scanning, or documents that are not legible will not be accepted. All emailed documents must be received by the deadline date. more...

Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation Award
Son or daughter of Active duty, reserve or veteran U.S. Marine
*Son or daughter of U.S. Marine who has served at least 90 days and has received an Honorable Discharge, Medical Discharge or was killed while serving in the U.S. Marine Corps
*Son or daughter of an Active duty or reserve U.S. Navy Corpsman who is currently attached to a Marine unit, or was attached to a Marine unit
*The son or daughter of U.S. Navy Corpsman who was attached to a Marine unit and has received an Honorable Discharge, Medical Discharge, or was killed while serving in the U.S. Navy.
*Graduating from high school in 2014, or currently attending college or a vocational/technical institution, or planning to attend college or a vocational/technical institution in the fall of 2013.
*An eligible applicants maximum family adjusted gross income for 2012 must not exceed $82,000. The income guideline increases if eligible siblings also apply for a scholarship from the Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation. Siblings must apply in order for the guideline to increase. For the purpose of determining eligibility, non-taxable allowances (such as Basic Allowance for Housing) received by military members on active duty are NOT included in determining adjusted gross income.
*A GPA of at least 2.0
*Scholarships are limited to undergraduate studies at accredited educational and technical institutions. An eligible applicant must be pursuing a first bachelor’s degree or technical certificate. more...

Martin Luther King Jr. Graduate Scholarship
1) Graduate student enrolled in any college at CSU 2) Demonstrate academic excellence in graduate level coursework as well as academic accomplishment and promise demonstrated through scholarship, research, or artistry that is characteristic of the student’s discipline 3) Have actively contributed to the education of individuals from ethnically diverse populations – this should include activities that have aided specific individuals, advanced institutional policy or practice, called attention to educational need, encouraged persons of historically underrepresented populations to seek education or other appropriate and similar outcomes more...

Martin Luther King Jr. Scholarship
*Any US citizen admitted to the Graduate School pursuing a graduate degree.
*Good academic standing and full-time enrollment
*Persons on probation or who are provisionally admitted may not receive the award.
*Academic excellence-the awardee must have achieved an excellent record in formal coursework and in addition must have shown accomplishment and promise in the type of scholarship, research, or artistry that is characteristic of his or her discipline.
*Evidence of awards, recognitions, publications, performances, or exhibitions is important.
*Letters of recommendation and available test scores also are examined.
*Service to and advancement of minority education-the awardee must have actively contributed to the enhancement of individuals from ethnically diverse populations and must have served as a role model.
*Activities that have aided specific individuals, which have advanced institutional policy for diversity, which have called attention to educational needs, which have encouraged persons of historically underrepresented groups to seek education, or which have had similar effects are appropriate.
*Transcripts and other indicators of academic performance available in the applicants’ University files will be examined. Applicants need not submit additional copies of transcripts or scores.
*Letters of recommendation should be sent directly to Ludy Avalos, MLK Jr. Scholarship Coordinator, CSU Graduate School, 1005 Campus Delivery, Fort Collins CO 80523-1005, or may be sent via e-mail to lavalos@grad.colostate.edu.
*Awardee may be required to submit all original signed recommendation letters. more...

Mensa Education And Research Foundation Scholarship
*Be enrolled for the academic year following the award, in a degree program in an accredited American institute of post-secondary education, and be a resident of the area of the participating local group of Mensa. For the general awards, the applicant need not be a member of Mensa nor qualified for Mensa, and the general awards are unrestricted as to age, race, gender, level of post-secondary education and financial need.
*Awards will be made on the basis of an essay of fewer than 550 words, which describes the applicant’s career, vocational, or academic goal toward which the scholarship is to provide aid.
*Entries awarded at three levels: local, regional, & national
*To download an official entry form via the internet, visit the Foundation web site at: http://foundation.us.mensa.org/scholarships
*The scholarship application process opens Sept. 15 and closes Jan. 15. more...
