Michael Smith Scholars In Chemistry
1) Resident of Colorado pursuing a first bachelor’s degree and enrolling as a full-time freshman student at CSU 2) majoring in Chemistry in the College of Natural Sciences 3) Demonstrate financial need as established by the Office of Student Financial Services of CSU 4) Exhibit academic achievement demonstrated by high school grade point average, scholastic aptitude test scores, as well as academic rigor (It is the intent of the scholarship that each Michael Smith Scholars is awarded full tuition per academic year, renewable for three additional years provided the recipient continues to meet all criteria and maintains good academic standing. No student shall be awarded more than eight semester of support.) more...

Michael Yasick Adhd Scholarship
Be accepted to and will be enrolled in an undergraduate program (graduate programs students are not eligible) at an accredited 2-year or 4-year college, university, trade school, technical school, or vocational school, or other *eligible educational institution, as this term is defined in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time (a “Qualifying Institution”).
Graduate programs are excluded
*Be a legal resident of the fifty (50) United States or the District of Columbia
*At the time of submitting the Application, each applicant must be diagnosed with ADHD and under the care of a licensed health care provider for ADHD, although no specific future or ongoing plan of management or treatment for applicants ADHD is required in order for applicant to be eligible to receive a Scholarship.
Each potential award recipient must provide proof of age (a notarized, legible copy of a birth certificate, drivers license, passport, military identification card, or other identification card issued by the state or federal governments, etc, containing your date of birth) with the Acceptance Package (as defined below).
*All applicants selected as potential award recipients must have a licensed health care professional confirm their ADHD diagnosis by completing a Certification of Diagnosis and submitting it to Shire. Shire will mail potential award recipients the Certification of Diagnosis form. Potential award recipients who fail to provide a Certification of Diagnosis by a licensed health care professional will not receive an award. more...

Scholarship for member and an officer of Microbiology Student Association who is an undergraduate student attending Colorado State University, majoring in Microbiology. Award amount varies. more...

Microbiology Undergraduate Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen or continuing undergraduate students attending Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Microbiology. Selection based on high school grades and ACT/SAT scores. ANumber of awards and award amount varies. Recipient must maintain a 3.0 GPA. more...

Micromotion Engineering Scholarship

Microsoft Disability Scholarship
Be a current high school senior with living with a disability (as defined by WHO), whether that be visual, hearing, mobility, cognitive or speech.
*Plan to attend an undergraduate program in a 2 or 4-year University/College or Technical College in the fall of the academic year following high-school graduation. Schools must be in the USA or have a USA-Affiliate for financial transactions (contact Seattle Foundation to verify non-USA schools eligibility).
*Declare a major in engineering, computer science, computer information systems, legal or in business that are approved (ie. paralegal, pre-law, finance, business administration, or marketing).
*Demonstrate a passion for technology.
*Demonstrate leadership at school and/or in the community.
*Have a high school cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
*Require financial assistance to attend college
*Enrollment status must be full-time or half time.
*see website for additional requirements. more...

Microsoft Scholarships/Interships
*To be eligible, you must be enrolled full time in a Bachelor’s degree program at a college or university in the United States, Canada, or Mexico at the time you submit the application.
*you must maintain a 3.0 cumulative grade point average out of a possible 4.0, or a 4.0 cumulative grade point average out of a possible 5.0.
*Five items to include in your application: Resume, Transcript, Answer to essay questions, letter of referral, and Printed comfirmation page from online application.
*essay questions on line. more...

Monfort Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to Colorado State University full-time by March 1. Applicants must rank in the top 5% of their graduating class (or rank 1st or 2nd in a class fewer than 40 students); have an SAT score of at least 1300 or ACT of 30; have evidence of leadership, service to community and school; and outstanding character. be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Number of awards varies. Award amount is equal to tuition and fees, room and board stipend and a book allowance. more...

Financial need is not a requirement. Preference given to students graduating from Fort Collins High School. more...

Morris K. Udall Scholarship Undergraduate Scholarship
*Approx. 120 scholarships made on basis of merit to two groups of students:
*1) College sophomores or juniors in the current academic year who have outstanding potential & who study the environmental & related fields. “Sophomore” is defined as a student who plans two more years of full-time undergraduate study beginning the next academic year. “Junior” is student who plans one more year of full-time undergraduate study beginning the next academic year
*2) Native American & Alaska Native students who are college sophomores or juniors in the current academic year, who have outstanding potential, & are in fields related to health care or tribal policy. Documentation must be provided for tribal affiliation
*College GPA of at least a “B” or the equivalent. Must be U.S. citizen, permanent resident alien, or U.S. national
*Two-year & four-year institutions are eligible to nominate a total of 6 students from either or both categories; recommended that total be equally divided
*Student must be nominated by his/her college/university using official nomination materials provided to each institution. Faculty representative serves as a liaison between institution & the Foundation. Faculty representative publicizes Udall Scholarship on campus, solicits faculty recommendations of outstanding students, establishes a process to select best-qualified candidates, helps nominees prepare for competition, & ensures nominations are complete & forwarded to Udall Scholarship Review Committee by stated deadline
*Broad range of disciplines. Majors have included: environmental engineering, agriculture, biology & other natural sciences, natural resource management, political science, sociology, anthropology, geography, cultural studies, history, public policy, & pre-law
*Native American & Alaska Native scholars have come from such backgrounds as American Indian studies, political science, sociology, geography, anthropology, tribal policy, economic development, government, health care, health sciences, & health policy
*Is anticipated that plan of study will include coursework in ethics & public policy and/or public or community service experience in the area of the candidate’s career field
*Each scholar receives up to $5,000, or the cost of tuition, fees, books, and room & board, whichever is less
*Scholars selected during their sophomore year may be renominated during the next year’s competition. Junior nominees may not be renominated. Freshmen are not eligible more...

Msu Denver Displaced Aurarian (Daapp) Scholarship
The MSU Denver Displaced Aurarian (DAAPP) Scholarship is available to undergraduate and graduate students at Metropolitan State University of Denver. To be eligible for this award, you must provide proof that you, your parent, or grandparent resided in the Auraria neighborhood in Denver, CO, between 1955-1973. Additionally, you must be a Colorado resident. This award is renewable provided that a GPA of at least 2.0 is maintained. more...

Nacme Pre-Engineering Scholarship Program
African American, American Indian, or Latino high school graduating seniors
*U.S. citizens or permanent residents
*Participants in an Academy of Engineering (a National Academy Foundation national network of career-themed academies) or a pre-college or high school program focused on math, science, and engineering
*Outstanding academic achievers earning a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA or *B average
*Have a preferred combined SAT score of 1650 for critical reading, writing, and math, and a preferred math score of 550; or preferred composite ACT score of 24 and a preferred score from the math section of 24
*Admitted into an engineering program as a full-time student. Priority will be given to applicants who have been admitted to a NACME Partner University. more...

Naehcy Scholarship Program
Applicants must submit:A completed application form; An essay about the impact of homelessness on the their lives and their desire to attend college (500-1,000 words; An official school transcript, include class ranking if available; and a minimum of one letter of recommendation from a teacher, counselor, or other adult who can speak to the applicants qualifications and experiences.
Students’ applications will be evaluated on:1) Demonstrated commitment to education during the experience of homelessness; academic achievement and accomplishments; potential impact of the scholarship for the students educational career and discussion of how the scholarship money would be used.
*Statement of goals and career interests; and grammar and use of language. more...

Nahn Nursing Scholarship
NAHN scholarship application form completed by the student and submitted by the deadline date.
*Two (2) Letters of Recommendation from two faculty members outlining the applicants future professional contribution to the nursing profession and potential to act as a role model for other aspiring nursing students.
An essay, 300 words or less (using Times New Roman * 12 font), written by the student that reflects their qualifications and potential for leadership in nursing.
*A resume, which includes earned certificates, awards, community service and special honors.
*Provide one page essay that includes: a discussion of economic needs; delineates monthly income and expenses; estimates of educational expenses, including any other financial aid for the year requested. Include also a copy of most recent W-2 form.
*An official transcript from applicants college, university, or Nursing Program.
*Academic standing (minimum GPA of 3.0 preferred).
*Verification of membership status in NAHN (must be a NAHN member for at least six months).
*NAHN members can reapply for scholarships if attaining a higher degree. more...

National Academies Fellowships
*The Research Associate ship awards are open to doctoral level scientists and engineers (U.S and Foreign Nationals) who can apply their special knowledge and talents to research areas that are of interest to them and to the participating
*Awards are available for Postdoctoral Associates (within 5 years of the doctorate) and Senior Associates (normally 5 years or more beyond the doctorate).
*Contact prospective Research Advisor(s)to discuss your interest. Advisor contact information can be found on Web site. Note that you may apply for up to three laboratories with on application.
*Follow application insturctions carefully. Applications must be submitted electronically. Supporting documents should be mail to address above.
*Ford Founation Fellowship Programs Tel: 202-334-2872 Fax: 202-334-3419 E-mail: infofell@nas.edu
*Jefferson Science Fellowship Phone: 202-334-2643 Fax: 202-334-2759 Emal: jsf@nas.edu

National Academy For Nuclear Training Scholarship Program
*U.S. citizen or U.S. national
*Enrolled full-time(minimum of twelve hours) at accredited four-year U.S. college/university
*Minimum 3.0 (B) GPA
*At least one, but no more than three academic years of study remaining to graduation (for co-operative education students, no more than six in-school semesters or nine quarters)
*Majoring in an approved curriculum: nuclear engineering, chemical engineering (with nuclear or power option), electrical or mechanical engineering, power generation health-physics
*Free of post-college obligations (e.g., ROTC or NUPOC) or active military service
*Preference given to students demonstrating preparation for careers in the U.S. nuclear power industry
*For safety, security, & other considerations, the nuclear power industry adheres to a strict fitness-for-duty policy that provides a working environment free from the effects of alcohol or drug abuse. All employees must comply with this policy.
*Submit complete package to your school engineering dept. by 1/24/14. Schools mail applications by 2/1/14 to the above address.
*For additional information, contact: National Academy for Nuclear Training Scholarship Program/700 Galeria Parkway SE, Suite 100/Atlanta, GA 30339-5957/1-800-828-5489/nanteap@inpo.org more...

National Association Of Women In Construction Metro Denver Chapter #112
*Must be attending or planning on attending a Colorado university, college or trade school during the academic year, pursuing a course of instruction leading to a bachelor’s degree or certificate of completion in a construction related field.
*Scholarships are available to all students – female or male. Awards are made annually in May. The scholarship includes reimbursement of academic expenses for tuition, books and lab fees.
*To be considered for the scholarship, please supply the following: 1) completed application form 2) transcript of grades for the most recently completed term 3) proof of acceptance by a university, college or vocational school located within the State of Colorado if applicable.
*Forward application with all necessary documentation to: NAWIC Metro Denver Chapter #112 Scholarship Committee Chair P.O. Box 40208 Denver, CO 80204
*Must be Colorado resident
*Vona J. Wagner and June Reiley Scholarship Funds – administered by the National Association of Women in Construction (NAWIC) more...

*Applicant must be in good standing and maintain a minimum of a 3.0 GPA
*1. At time of his/her application, the student must have satisfactorily completed 15 semester hours (or quarter hour equivalent) of work at regionally accredited colleges or universities.
*2. The applicant must indicate on his/her application the transportation/physical distribution, logistics,r information technology or other business courses he/she plans to incorporate into his/her degree program.
*Scholarships are limited to those seeking an undergraduate degree.
*A brief statement from a responsible administrator stating that the proposed courses will constitute acceptable work toward a degree must be attached to the application.

National Garden Clubs, Inc. Scholarship
Deadline is February 1. Winner at the state level ($2000) will be considered for one of 35 $3500 scholarships at the national level.
*Must be a US Citizen or Permanent Legal Resident of the United States.
*International or Foreign Exchange Students & Doctoral program students are not eligible.
*Agronomy, Agriculture Education, Floriculture, Horticulture, Landscape Design, Botany, Biology,Forestry,Wildlife Science, Plant Pathology/Science,City (Rural & Urban) Planning Habitat or Forest/Systems Ecology,Environmental Concerns (Management: Environmental, Horticulture Resource/Environmental Behavior) Environmental Conservation (inc. Engineering, etc.),Land Management and/or other related or allied subjects
*Must have a 3.25 average (3.0 on a 4.0 point scale) in order to apply.
*Applications must be mailed to the State Garden Club Scholarship Chairman for the state in which the applicant is a legal resident, even if the student is attending an out-of-state school. more...

National Institues Of Health (Nih) Undergraduate Scholarship Program
*The NIH Undergraduate Scholarships are awarded on a competitive basis to students who show a commitment to pursuing careers in biomedical, behavioral, and social science health-related research.
*U.S. citizen, national, or qualified non-citizen.
*Enrolled or accepted for enrollment as a full-time student for the at an accredited undergraduate institution.
*From a disadvantaged background. Disadvantaged background means that you have “exceptional financial need” as defined by the Federal Government.
*3.5 GPA or higher (on a 4.0 scale) or within the top 5 percent of your class.
*For each full or partial scholarship year, you are committed to two NIH service obligations. The obligations are benefits of the UGSP-providing you with invaluable research training and experience at the NIH.
*1) 10-week Summer Laboratory Experience. After each year of scholarship support, you will train for 10 weeks as a paid summer research employee in an NIH research laboratory.
*2) Employment at the NIH after Graduation. After graduation, you will continue your training as a full-time employee in an NIH research laboratory. You must serve 1 year of full-time employment for each year of scholarship.
*Strong applicants are able to demonstrate their commitment to a research career. Applicants are most able to demonstrate this commitment if they have already participated in laboratory research, been involved in extra-curricular science activities, or have taken advanced courses relevant to their field.
*January 2, 2014 – Online Application Opens March 3, 2014 – Online Application Closes more...

National Italian American Foundation Scholarship Program
*Enrolled in an accredited institution of higher education for fall 2012
*GPA of at least 3.25
*United States citizen or permanent resident alien
*Fit into one of the two NIAF scholarship categories. General Category I: Italian American students who demonstrate outstanding potential & high academic achievements. Area of study: open. General Category II: students from any ethnic background majoring or minoring in Italian language, Italian studies, Italian American studies or a related field, who demonstrate outstanding potential & high academic achievements
*To be “Italian American” the student must have at least one ancestor who has immigrated from Italy
*Completed application submitted on-line, Teacher Evaluation Form submitted on-line, official school transcript submitted by mail, FAFSA Financial Aid Form submitted by mail (optional) more...

National Precast Concrete Association Educational Foundation Scholarship
*Must be attending or plan on attending an accredited institution of higher learning
*Must be pursuing an academic course of study in architecture, engineering, construction management, or other academic field related to the building, construction or PRECAST concrete industry & have it so declared on transcripts
*Must maintain minimum of 12 credit hours per term of enrollment
*Must have cumulative GPA of 2.8 on 4.0 scale Undergrad/3.5 on 4.0 grading scale for Grad
*Scholarships awarded based on course of study relative to application requirements, thoroughness of the completed application, scholastic standing, ACT/SAT scores, career goals & extra-curricular activities
*Applications may be secured from a local member of the Natl. Precast Concrete Assn. (NPCA), through the student’s counselor or advisor, by writing to the Foundation, or through the Foundation web site
*Application must be submitted through a member in good standing with NPCA, who has agreed to act as sponsor for the applicant. The applicant does not need to know the NPCA member personally in order to obtain the letter
*Colorado Members: Arco Concrete, Inc., Fort Lupton, CO; Boughton’s Precast, Inc., Pueblo, CO; Colorado Precast Concrete, Inc., Loveland, CO; Concrete Products of Utah, LLC, Denver, CO; E & C Precast Concrete, Inc., Littleton, CO; Firebaugh Precast, Inc., Colorado Springs, CO; Hughes Waterworks Sales Comp., Grand Junction, CO; Mountain Park Concrete, Inc., Granby, CO; Oldcastle Precast dba Amcor Precast, Littleton, CO; Rinker Materials-Hydro Conduit, Denver, CO; SEMA Precast, Inc., Englewood, CO; Trenwa, Inc., Dacono, CO; Vaughn Concrete Products, Inc., Henderson, CO; Winfrey Architectural Concrete, Erie, CO
*For add’l info., contact: Cindy S. Buckardt, Colorado Precast Concrete; past president of NPCAEF. Her phone: (970)669-0535; fax: (970)669-0674; address: Colorado Precast Concrete/1820 S.E. 14th St./Loveland, CO 80537-8805. Cindy can also write a letter for an applicant. more...

National Western Stock Show Association Scholarship Trust
The National Western Stock Show Association Scholarship Trust is available to first-year students at University of Colorado-Anschutz who are enrolled in the Physical Therapy Program. You must intend to practice physical therapy in rural Colorado or Wyoming for 3 years post-graduation to be eligible for this award. more...

National Western Stock Show Beef Industry Fellowship - Csu
The National Western Stock Show Beef Industry Fellowship is available to a graduate student in the Beef Industry Leadership Program at Colorado State University. You must demonstrate strong written and oral communication skills, strong interpersonal communication skills, the ability to be a team player, motivation and commitment to a career with the beef industry to be eligible for this award. more...

National Western Stock Show Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Colorado State Universitys College of Agricultural Sciences with a major relating to the Livestock Industry, and who are former exhibitors or contestants in the National Western Stock Show or Fall Classic (National Western 4-H Round-up participants are ineligible.) Preference given to freshmen. Student must be a U.S. citizen, show good attitude, initiative conducive to ongoing leadership, scholastic achievement, financial need, and career potential. Admissions application to the College of Agricultural Sciences is reviewed for all scholarships. Renewable; maintain 2.8 GPA first year, 3.0 thereafter. more...

National Western Stock Show Scholarship - Colorado State University
The National Western Stock Show Scholarship is available to freshmen majoring in a subject related to the livestock industry and enrolled in the College of Agricultural Sciences at Colorado State University. Sophomores, juniors or seniors may be considered. You must be a former exhibitor or contestant in the National Western Stock Show or Fall Classic and maintain a 3.0 GPA or higher. Additionally, you must demonstrate leadership, scholarship, financial need, career potential, attitude and initiative to be eligible for this award. If awarded freshman year and renewed through sophomore and junior year, you will receive an award of $4,000 senior year. more...

National Western Stock Show-Senior Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate seniors attending Colorado State Universitys College of Agricultural Sciences with a major relating to the Livestock Industry, and who are former exhibitors or contestants in the National Western Stock Show or Fall Classic (National Western 4-H Round-up participants are ineligible.) Student must be a U.S. citizen, show good attitude, initiative conducive to ongoing leadership, scholastic achievement (minimum 3.0 GPA), financial need, and career potential. This award is for the seniors who have received the scholarship since their freshman year. more...

National Western-Jim Henry Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate juniors attending Colorado State Universitys College of Agricultural Sciences with a major relating to the Livestock Industry, and who are winners/recipients of the National Western Stock Show Scholarship(NWSS). Student must be a U.S. citizen, show good attitude, initiative conducive to ongoing leadership, scholastic achievement, financial need, and career potential. Recipient is selected by Student Affairs Committee; an additional $1000 over the NWSS amount. more...

Navy Health Professions Scholarship Program (Hpsp)
The Health Professions Scholarship Program is designed to provide a financial incentive for students in designated health care professions to complete degree requirements and obtain a commission as a Navy Physician, Dentist, Optometrist, or Psychologist.
Benefits:
• 3 and 4 year scholarships available
• $20,000 signing bonus (Medicine & Dentistry)
• 100% of your tuition is paid
• Monthly stipend of $2,200.73 to spend as you like
• All educationally required school fees (minus housing and meals) are paid
• Full reimbursement required books, supplies, and equipment
Eligibility Requirements:
• Citizenship – Must be a U.S. Citizen
• Age – Complete your degree by age 42
• Health – Must meet the Navy’s physical requirements
• Education – Must be enrolled in, or accepted to an accredited graduate program in one of the following fields: Medicine (MD or DO), Dentistry, Clinical Psychology, or Optometry. Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above to apply. You may apply before acceptance to graduate school but must ultimately gain acceptance.
Service Obligation:
• Contract is year for year, but typically 3 or 4 years upon graduation or after residency for Medicine
How to Apply:
• To apply for the Health Professions Scholarship Program, request additional information, or if you have questions, contact:
Chief Matt Birchall
Navy Health Professions
225 E. 16th Ave, Suite 300
Denver, CO 80203
Matthew.birchall@navy.mil
303-866-1984, Ext. 352 more...

Navy Health Service Collegiate Program (Hscp) Medical Service Corps
The Health Services Collegiate Program is designed to provide financial incentive for students in designated health care professions to complete degree/certification requirements and obtain a commission in the Medical Service Corps (MSC)
Benefits:
• Receive a monthly military salary anywhere from $3500 to $5610* while attending graduate school.
• A Full Comprehensive health-care benefits package.
• Time in this program counts towards a pension.
• Earn vacation while in this program.
• You pay for tuition, books, and other school expenses but salary can be used forwards these items.
• * Navy HSCP housing allowance based on graduate school location. Increased offer amounts available in areas with higher cost of living.
- This is an Officer Program offering higher initial salary and benefits than enlisted programs.
Eligibility Requirements:
• Citizenship – Must be a U.S. Citizen.
• Age – Complete your degree by age 42.
• Education – Must be enrolled in or accepted for transfer to an accredited college, university or school of study for a designated health profession. Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above to apply. Must complete studies/training as full time students attending all normal school sessions (3 semesters), and must maintain GPA of at least 3.0 after selection.
• Degree/certification requirements must be fulfilled within 24 months. Selectees must have an approved degree/course of study completion plan approved by Navy Recruiting Command.
Service Obligation:
• Three years active duty from the date of commissioning for any one, two, or three year program.
Programs eligible for HSCP:
Health Care Admin Environmental Health Industrial Hygiene Audiology
Pharmacy Occupational Therapy Entomology Physician Assistant
How to Apply:
To apply for HSCP, or additional information, or if you just have questions, contact
Chief Matt Birchall
Navy Health Professions
Phone: 303-866-1984, EXT 352
Email: matthew.birchall@navy.mil more...

Nbna Scholarship Program
*Must be a member of NBNA and a member of a local chapter (if one exists in your area). Candidate must be currently enrolled in a nursing program (B.S.N., A.D., Diploma or L.P.N./ L.V.N.) and in good scholastic standing at the time of application.
*Applicant must have at least one full year of school remaining.
*Official Transcript(s) from an accredited School of Nursing.
*Two (2) page Written Essay
*Two (2) letters of recommendation (one from applicant’s school of nursing and one from the local chapter, or a nurse in the area if a local chapter does not exist). Letters of recommendation and essay must be attached to the application.
*A clean/clear professional headshot.
*Additional items to accompany the application in support of the candidate’s eligibility and desirability may include documented evidence of: a. participation in student nurse activities and b. involvement in the African American Community, i.e., letters, news clippings, awards, certificates, etc. more...

In exchange for a minimum 2-year service commitment at a critical shortage facility located in a HPSA, the NURSE Corps Scholarship Program pays: *tuition *eligible fees *other reasonable costs, such as books, clinical supplies/instruments and uniforms. *monthly stipend of ($1,302 for the 2014-2015 school year)
*U.S. citizens (born or naturalized), nationals or lawful permanent residents
*enrolled or accepted for enrollment in a professional nursing degree program (baccalaureate, graduate, associate degree, or diploma) at accredited school of nursing located in the U.S.
*begin classes no later than September 30
*free from any Federal judgment liens
*free from existing service commitments
*not delinquent on a Federal debt
*Preference is given to qualified applicants with the greatest financial need who are enrolled or accepted for enrollment in an accredited undergraduate nursing program or Masters nurse practitioner program as full-time students. more...

Students must be enrolled full-time, in good academic standing with a GPA of 2.75 or better, or continuing their education at an accredited institution (college, junior or community college, or technical school).
*Students will be asked to provide a list of community services performed or involved in during the last four years if awarded scholarship.
*Applicants must submit a copy of an acceptance letter from the two year or four year accredited college, university or vocational institution if awarded scholarship.
*U.S. citizens and students with an Alien Registration number currently enrolled in state-approved schools of nursing or pre-nursing in associate degree, baccalaureate, diploma, generic doctorate, and generic masters programs. Funds are not available for graduate study unless it is for a first degree in nursing.

Overseas Press Club Foundation Scholarships And Internships
*Graduate and undergraduate students, studying at American colleges and universities, who aspire to become foreign correspondents, are invited to apply for one of 14 $2,000 scholarships and $3000 internships to be awarded by the Overseas Press Club Foundation.
*Applicants do not have to be US citizens. Submit cover letter, Resume and Essay by mail, fax, or email (email is preferred-Word or PDF).
*Essay needs to be approximately 500 words and should concentrate on an area of the world or an international issue that is in keeping with the applicant’s interest. It can be in the form of a story, news analysis or a traditional essay.
*Cover letter should be autobiographical in nature. Include your address, phone number, and email at both school and home. more...

Describe how 21st century technologies may suffer the same_____.

Perry & Teresa Blach Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior attending Colorado State University, enrolled in the College of Agricultural Sciences with a major in Agribusiness or Agricultural Science. Applicant must have strong work ethic with a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference given to student with rural background, but not necessary to have farming experience. Admissions application to the College of Agricultural Sciences is reviewed for all scholarships. more...

Peter H. Holme, Jr. Memorial Scholarship
The Peter H. Holme, Jr. Memorial Scholarship is available to JD students at the University of Denver, Sturm College of Law. You must demonstrate outstanding trial advocacy skills to be eligible for this award. more...

Petry Scholarship
Annual award for beginning graduate student attending Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Animal Sciences with interest in animal breeding. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, leadership qualities and potential for the field of professional engineering. Candidates must be a U.S. citizen. Preference given to Colorado or Wyoming graduate. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Phi Beta Kappa Society/Mary Isabel Sibley Fellowship
*Unmarried women between 25 and 35 years of age
*Study of French language and literature
*Demonstrated ability to carry on original research
*Must hold doctorate or have fulfilled all requirements for doctorate except the dissertation
*Eligibility not restricted to members of Phi Beta Kappa
*If you have problems logging on to the website the way it is, please go to the website pbk/org and click fellowships you will then click on the Sibley Fellowship. more...

Phi Theta Kappa Presidents Scholarship
Scholarship for Phi Theta Kappa members who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Adams State College. Students must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and be U.S. citizens. Number of awards may vary. A personal letter must be included with application packet. Renewable. more...

Phi Zeta Scholarship
Scholarship for graduate DVM students attending Colorado State University full-time, in first year of Veterinary Medicine. Applicants must have academic merit. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Philip A. Connolly Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate students attending Colorado State University full-time, enrolled in the Warner College of Natural Resources. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Consideration given for financial need. Preference given to juniors or seniors; preference also given to students who participate in extracurricular activities and who have demonstrated their leadership potential through personal responsibility and job performance. Preference given to students from Minnesota. more...

Phillip J. Hiegert Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for graduate PVM students attending Colorado State University full-time, in first or second year of Veterinary Science. Applicants must have good academic standing, financial need and potential for a successful veterinary career. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Physics Alumni Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Physics. Applicant must have exceptional ability in coursework or research activities. more...

Pinnacle Scholarship
1) Enrolled as a full-time undergraduate student 2) Be in any college, pursuing any major 3) Demonstrate financial need as established by the Office of Student Financial Services of CSU 4) Have been in the foster care system at any time since his/her 13th birthday (i.e. foster home, group home 5) Abide by all University standards for appropriate conduct and community behavior 6) Maintain a cumulative 2.0 GPA 7 ) Applicants must include responses to essay questions defined by the Donors (Scholarship may be renewable if the recipient reapplies, continues to meet all criteria and is selected by the scholarship committee) more...

Pinnacol Foundation Scholarship Program
*Established for the benefit of children of Colorado workers killed or permanently disabled in a compensable work-related accident or by an occupational disease
*Must be the natural, adopted or step-child of, or fully dependant on a worker killed or permanently injured in a compensable work-related accident or by a compensable occupational disease during the course & scope of employment with a Colorado-based employer. The parent, or deceased parent’s family, must have been entitled to receive benefits under the Colorado Workers’ Compensation Act
*Must be between the ages of 16 and 25 at time of application
*Must have a high school diploma, GED, or be a high school senior in good standing
*Must demonstrate financial need
*Academic achievement, aptitude, work history, and community service of the applicant are considered
*Application must include documentation of parent’s workers’ compensation claim. If the family does not have documentation of compensability of the claim, they should contact the Division of Workers’ Compensation (DOWC) at 303-318-8700. If the DOWC is unable to provide claim information, the student should contact Pinnacol Foundation at 303-361-4775
*The amount of awards are based on financial need, academic achievement, letters of recommendation, a personal essay, & severity of the parent’s injury
*Emailing to pinnacol.foundation@pinnacol.com
*Applications are accepted February 1 to April 15 each year more...

Plains Anthropological Society Native American Student Award
*Must be Native American
*Must be enrolled in a four-year college or university in the Plains area of the United States or Canada
*Must be either undergraduate or graduate students in Anthropology
*Submit necessary documentation: completed nomination form, student resume, letter of recommendation from a faculty member, & photocopy of student’s tribal enrollment certificate more...

Poettmann Scholarship Fund
The Poettmann Scholarship Fund is open to graduate students at the Colorado School of Mines. You must be majoring in petroleum engineering in order to be considered for this award. more...

Political Science Outstanding Junior Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior attending Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Political Science. Recipient is selected by the faculty from among majors who have completed between 60-90 credits, including at least 60 credits at Colorado State. Applicant must have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher and a GPA of 3.5 or higher in Political Science courses. Student must have a strong record of public service. One of the letters of recommendation must come from a Political Science professor. Award amount varies. more...

Political Science Outstanding Senior Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate senior attending Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Political Science. Recipient must possess outstanding academic achievement and show evidence of leadership in academic, university or community affairs. One of the students letters of recommendation must come from a Political Science professor. Award amount varies. more...

The Political Science Outstanding Student Annual Scholarship is available to full-time undergraduate students at MSU Denver who have completed at least 75 credit hours. You must be a Political Science major and have a minimum GPA of 3.3 to be eligible for this award. more...

Progressive Automations' Annual Scholarship Program
*Applicants must be enrolled for the September 2014 semester, full-time at a recognized, Canadian or American post-secondary college or university at the undergraduate level.
*Applications must be enrolled in their first year in an engineering program
*Applicants must have Canadian or American citizenship.
*Applicants must demonstrate high academic performance by submitting a copy of their high-school transcripts.
*Applicants must demonstrate financial need and be eligible to receive financial aid.
*You are not eligible if you have already received the award in a previous year.
*Employees and family members of Progressive Automations are not eligible to participate more...

Pueblo Hispanic Education Foundation Horisons/Grad Scholarship
*Must be a resident of the State of Colorado
*Maintain a 2.5 cumulative GPA for first-time college freshmen, 3.0 cumulative GPA for continuing student.
*The Pueblo Hispanic Education Foundation (PHEF) was established in Pueblo, Colorado in 1988.
*The foundation focuses on removing financial as well as other barriers that might prevent students from securing an education, and gaining employment. The foundation’s purpose is to secure funds for scholarships and other educational support for low-moderate income students. more...

Race For Education Scholarships
Must be 24 years old or younger as of September 1, of the application year.
*Must have at least 2.85 cumulative GPA
*Have an annual household income of $50,000 or less
*Please check the website for more specific information regarding eligibility requirements for each scholarship.
*To be considered financially independent, a student must be at least 24 years old OR married OR a veteran OR an orphan OR have dependents of his or her own. Applicants who have been legally emancipated must provide documentation indicating such. No exceptions will be considered. more...

Railway Tie Association John Mabry Forestry Scholarship
*As a railroad supply organization, the Railway Tie Association has a vested interest in the continued improvements of all railroad-related products. Meeting the challenge of the railroad industry in the decades ahead will require a high quality of products & the foresight, determination, & technical expertise of supplier management. RTA wishes to assist potential industry leaders of the future.
*Juniors & seniors(not graduating before the end of the school year)
*Must be enrolled in accredited forestry schools
*Emphasis placed on: leadership qualities, career objectives, scholastic achievement, financial need

Rmaee/Rocky Mountain Association Of Energy Engineers Scholarships
*To encourage qualified practitioners in energy engineering and energy management by awarding scholarships to further education in the field.
*Available to both undergraduate and graduate degree candidates who are enrolled in engineering or management programs at accredited colleges or universities.
*Funds are to be used for courses directly related to energy engineering or energy managment, preferably with curriculum leading to a major or minor in energy engineering.
*A personal recommedation form a faculty member of the school that the student is attending, that discribes the student’s academic standing , character, and financial need.
*Current Transcript
*A 50-100 Word Statement from student explianning why the student wishes to study energy engineering or energy management. This statement should also discribe finanical need. more...

Rmcad Academic Scholarship
The RMCAD Academic Scholarship is available to incoming new students at Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design. You must be enrolled on a full-time basis and have a minimum GPA of 3.5 to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

Rmcad Artistic Scholarship
The RMCAD Artistic Scholarship is available to incoming new students at Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design. You must be enrolled on a full-time basis and have a minimum GPA of 3.0 to be eligible for this renewable award. Selection is based on the strength and quality of your admission portfolio as determined by the Portfolio Review Committee. more...

Rmcad Best Of Colorado Scholarship
The RMCAD Best of Colorado Scholarship is available to incoming freshman students at Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design who have graduated from a Colorado high school. You must be enrolled on a full-time basis and have a minimum GPA of 3.0 to be eligible for this renewable award. Selection is based on the strength and quality of your admission portfolio as determined by the Portfolio Review Committee and an essay submission. more...

Rmcad Presidential Scholarship-Gold
The RMCAD Presidential Scholarship-Gold is available to incoming new students at Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design. You must be enrolled on a full-time basis and have a minimum GPA of 3.5 to be eligible for this renewable award. Selection is based on the student's potential to make a significant impact in the field of art and design. more...

Rmcad Presidential Scholarship-Platinum
The RMCAD Presidential Scholarship-Platinum is available to incoming new students at Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design. You must be enrolled on a full-time basis and have a minimum GPA of 3.75 to be eligible for this renewable award. Selection is based on the student's potential to make a significant impact in the field of art and design. more...

Rmcad Presidential Scholarship-Silver
The RMCAD Presidential Scholarship-Silver is available to incoming new students at Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design. You must be enrolled on a full-time basis and have a minimum GPA of 3.25 to be eligible for this renewable award. Selection is based on the student's potential to make a significant impact in the field of art and design. more...

Rmcad Student Ambassador Grant
The RMCAD Student Ambassador Grant is available to students who take part in the Student Ambassador program at Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design. Ambassadors are hired to serve as peer mentors to new students during Orientation and throughout the first year. They work to create community amongst the diverse group of artists and designers at RMCAD by planning events for the entire student body and within the academic departments, as well as civic engagement projects. more...

*To encourage young professionals to seek higher education in a water-related field
*Must be a member or dependant of a member of the RMSAWWA
*Must be a student who will be at least a junior in the next fall term, pursuing a degree at an accredited college or university
*Fields of study related to the drinking water industry, such as engineering, biology, chemistry, or environmental science.
*Two scholarships availble from RMSAWWA are Small Systems Management Scholarship and James B. Warner Scholarship. more...

Rocky Mountain Chapter Women Of Defense (Wid) Regional Scholarship Program
*High school senior, undergraduate college student, or graduate college
*Accepted or enrolled in an accredited university or college pursuing a degree in science, technology, engineering, or math disciplines
*Demonstrate leadership potential in science, engineering, or math
*Have a minimum grade point average of 3.5 for high school seniors, 3.0 for college students
*Be a woman;Reside in the Colorado Springs, Colorado, area (includes Pueblo, Denver, Woodland Park and surrounding communities)
*Be a citizen of the United States

Rocky Mountain Electrical League (Rmel) Foundation
*Click on Foundation after entering website, you will see a link to scholarships. You should be able to download an application from there.
*The applicant must be a high school senior, high school graduate or college undergraduate.
*In addition you must fulfill ONE of the following: 1.) Be pursuing or plan to pursue an electric industry position certificate or associate degree at a college (community college, 4-year college or a 4-year university) and be able to provide information about the specific program you are or will attend and the accreditation status of the institution 2.) Be pursuing or plan to pursue an undergraduate degree with intent to pursue a career in the electric energy industry. College undergraduates must be taking the minimum number of semester hours that the institution requires for the student to be considered full time.
*The scholarship process typically begins each January with applications being mailed out and posted on the web site. Applications are due in March and scholarship recipients are notified in April. more...

*Undergraduate in a wildlife related natural resource program
*In a four-year college/university in the United States or Canada
*Have junior or senior standing (completed a minimum of 56 semester hours or 108 quarter hours) by the completion of the spring semester/quarter
*Have at least one semester or two quarters remaining in their degree program
*Enrolled as a full-time student for the following fall semester/quarter
*Complete Scholarship Application Form, Enrollment Verification Form, & enclose 2 letters of recommendation
*Previous recipients ineligible
*Click on Conservation at top of page, then on Conservation Education programs.

*Applicant must be a member in good standing in the RMWEA or a dependent of a RMWEA member who is in good standing in the RMWEA.
*The applicant must be officially enrolled as a part-time or full-time student at a colelge or university for fall 2014.
*For high school students, enrolling in a 2- or 4-year college or university for study related to the water environment profession. Must be a high school senior in good standing, who has applied to a college or university with the interest of pursuing an environmental career.
*Must show proof of enrollment in the environmental related program at the college or university for fall 2014.

Ron Brown Scholar Program
*Highly motivated African-American high school seniors
*Intend to pursue undergraduate degrees full-time
*May pursue any academic discipline & attend the college or university of their choice
*Have outstanding promise, show exceptional leadership potential, and seek to become leaders in business, education, government, & a wide spectrum of professions
*Students who will make significant contributions to society & to their communities; commitment to public service, & desire to make a difference
*Must excel academically
*Must demonstrate financial need
*Scholars also benefit with summer internships, career guidance, placement opportunities, mentors, & leadership training
*During college, Scholars are required to pursue at least one summer internship devoted to community service & one pre-professional internship
*Scholars may request that all or a portion of the award be utilized each year of undergraduate study or deferred for graduate study
*November 1st – application will be considered for the Ron Brown Scholar Program AND forwarded to a select and limited number of additional scholarship providers.
*January 9th – final postmarked deadline in order to be considered for only the Ron Brown Scholar Program ONLY. more...

Science, Mathematics, And Research For Transformation (Smart) Defense Scholarship For Service Program
The Science, Mathematics And Research for Transformation (SMART) Scholarship for Service Program has been established by the Department of Defense (DoD) to support undergraduate and graduate students pursuing degrees in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines.
*The program aims to increase the number of civilian scientists and engineers working at DoD laboratories.
*The DoD offers this scholarship for service to individuals who demonstrate outstanding ability and special aptitude for a career in scientific and engineering research and product development, express interest in career opportunities at DoD laboratories, and are pursuing a degree in or closely related to one of the following disciplines; Aeronautical and Astronautical Engineering Biosciences Chemical Engineering Chemistry Civil Engineering Cognitive, Neural, and Behavioral Sciences Computer and Computational Sciences Electrical Engineering Geosciences Information Sciences Materials Science and Engineering Mathematics Mechanical Engineering Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering Nuclear Engineering Oceanography Operations Research Physics
*During summer sessions, students will receive assignments as interns at DoD laboratories and agencies. After completion of their studies, SMART scholars will be employed in assignments aligned with their areas of interest and needs of the DoD.
*Eligibility Requirements All awardees must be, a U.S. citizen, 18 years of age or older able to participate in summer internships at DoD laboratories, willing to accept post-graduate employment with the DoD, a student in good standing with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale (at all schools attended) and, pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in one of the fields listed above.
*In addition; Undergraduate applicants must be currently enrolled in a regionally accredited U.S. college or university (i.e. undergraduate applicants must be at least freshman to apply and can apply for funding for their sophomore through senior years only).
*Financial Support Participants in the SMART Scholarship for Service Program receive; Annual stipend ranging from $22,000 – $39,000 depending on prior educational experience -Full tuition and related educational fees -Book allowance of $1,000 per academic year -Paid summer internships -Employment placement after graduation
*Graduate applicants can be either currently enrolled in a regionally accredited U.S. college or university or awaiting notification of admission to such. If awaiting admission, you must be accepted for entrance in the fall 2012 term.
**Graduate applicants must have taken the GRE within 5 years of the application deadline. Subject tests are not required.
*The SMART online application is open each August through December. The application will reopen August 15, 2013 and close December 15, 2014. Awardees will be announced in the spring of 2014 and funding wlll begin August 2014. more...

Senior Care Innovation Scholarship
*The annual scholarship award is for five (5) students enrolled in an associate’s degree, bachelor’s degree or graduate level program in the fields of gerontology, long term care administration, social work, medicine, nursing, or sociology at an accredited 2-year college or 4-year university.
*Employees of A Place for Mom and members of their immediate family (spouse, parent, child, sibling and their respective spouses, regardless of where they reside) and persons living in the same household, whether or not related, of such employees, are not eligible to apply.
*Applicants must complete a letter of introduction and a 500-word minimum essay on selected topic and sign the Scholarship Award Agreement.
*Scholarship will be awarded to five students who write the most compelling essay as judged by an outside panel of senior living professionals
*see website for essay topic and to apply. more...

Smith Publicity Book Marketing Scholarship

Social Science Research Council/ International Dissertation Field Research Fellowships
*Full-time graduate students in the humanities and social sciences – regardless of citizenship – enrolled in doctoral programs in the U.S.
*Applicants must have completed all Ph.D. requirements except the fieldwork and dissertation by the time the fellowship begins, or by Dec, whichever comes first.
*Fellowships provide support for 9 to 12 months in the field, plus travel expenses, and must be held for a single continuous period within the eighteen months between July and December.
*The IDRF program is committed to scholarship that advances knowledge about cultures, societies, aesthetics, economies and/or polities outside the US. It promotes work that is relevant to a particular discipline while resonating across other fields and area specializations.
*Applications must be submitted electronically using the SSRC’s Online Application Portal. For detailed information on application procedures, visit the IDRF website.
*Go to the website for further info. more...

Society Of Manufacturing Engineers (Sme) Education Foundation
*Graduating college senior who exemplifies leadership, service, perseverance and entrepreneurship. This award seeks to reward students for their academic and professional accomplishments as they entere the manufacturing workforce.
*Student must be nominated by SME student chapter faculty advisor and be a member of an SME chapter.
*Must be at senior class level and expect to graduate during 2013.
*Pursing degree in manufacturing engineering, technology, or a closely related engineering field.
*Demonstrate leadership capabilities and a prior work history (professional employment, student internship, co-op employment or volunteer service to the community).
*Must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
*Nomination Packet should include: Completed Nomination/Application Form, Letter of recommendaiton from faculty advisor (should address leadership skills and participation in student chapter activities, personal and professional accomplishments, awards and honors, work and/or volunteer experiencs and give examples of cooperation, attitude, team spirit, and professionalism.)
*Online application. more...

Society Of Women Engineers, National Headquarters
*The applicant is enrolled or has graduated in a baccalaureate ABET/CSAB accredited engineering or computer science degree program, or the applicant is accepted for enrollment in a baccalaureate computer science program at an ABET approved school. Please go to www.abet.org for more information.
*Able to accept the scholarship in the school year for which it is being awarded
*The minimum GPA is 3.0/4.0 for upperclass applicants.
*The applicant is not the current recipient of a renewable SWE Scholarship (i.e. is not already designated to receive a SWE scholarship payment in the coming academic year.) The applicant must be a full time student, except for reentry applicants.
*The applicant must be a US citizen or permanent resident of the US for some scholarships. The applicant is not receiving full funding for education from another organization (e.g. members of the Armed Services attending US Military Academies, students receiving full reimbursement from an employer).
*Multiple scholarships; only one application should be submitted
*The application for sophomores through graduate students is typically available December 1st through February 15th. For freshmen: March 1st through May 15th. more...

*Admission Requirements: Applicants must possess a high school diploma or GED with a cumulative grade point average or equivalent of 2.5 before program commences

The Alert Scholarship
must currently be a senior in high school.
*high school must be located in one of the following states: Alaska, Colorado, Idaho, Minnesota, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Oregon, South Dakota, Washington or Wyoming.
*must have a grade point average of 2.5 or better.
*must have plans to attend college after graduation (the college you will attend can be located in any state).
*Write an essay about a personal encounter you or someone you know has had with drug and/or alcohol abuse
*In your essay explain how the situation was dealt with, what you learned from it, what others can learn from the experience, and what was right or wrong (in your opinion) about the way the incident or problem was handled
*Scholarship essays are judged in the same way that essays written for a high school English class would be: thesis statement, supporting content, grammar, punctuation, etc.
*Essays must be typed, double-spaced, and 650800 words in length.
*Essays must include an official copy of your high school transcripts.
*Essays must also include a recent photo. Scholarship winners will have their picture reprinted in our magazine along with their winning essay, so please send a good quality color photo (no blurry printouts).
*No application is needed and there is no deadline, but you must meet the eligibility requirements and include all of the items listed above to be considered. more...

The Beverly Cavanaugh Memorial Scholarship/Iia Denver Chapter
Must be at least a part-time student (6 hours or more) in an undergraduate or graduate program
*Must have at least one semester remaining in degree program after May 2013
*Must have maintained acceptable academic performance in the past semester (no grades below a C)
*Must attend at least one Denver Chapter of the Institute of Internal Auditors meeting. The Scholarship will be awarded at the May 2013 meeting and that qualifies as attendance at one (1) meeting. A complete meeting schedule can be seen at the chapter website www.theiia.org/chapters/denver.
*Must complete a written Essay of 500 words or less describing *The Value of Internal Audit to a Corporation.
*Scholarships are awarded based upon demonstration of attributes possessed by honoree Bev Cavanaugh. Financial need is not considered a criterion. Desired activities and performance characteristics (i.e. attitude, commitment, leadership abilities, and community involvement) will factor heavily into the selection. more...

The Lagrant Foundation Scholarship
Must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident
*Must be a member of one of the following ethnic groups: African American/Black, Asian American/Pacific Islander, Hispanic/Latino or Native American/American Indian
*Must be a full-time student at a four-year, accredited institution, carrying a total of 12 units or more per semester/quarter
*Must have a minimum of 2.75 GPA (if you do not meet this requirement, please see the application checklist below)
*MUST major in a field of study that has an emphasis on public relations, marketing or advertising *Additional majors that also qualify are art, anthropology, communications, English, graphic design and sociology – while demonstrating a career path in advertising, marketing or public relations
*Must have at least one year to complete his/her degree from the time the scholarships are awarded
*If chosen, the applicant MUST attend TLFs career development workshop AND awards reception to receive the scholarship. The applicant must make a one-year commitment to maintain contact with TLF to receive professional guidance and academic support more...

The Praxair-Siad Engineering Study Abroad Scholaship
WHO CAN APPLY?
You can apply if you:
• Are a citizen of the U.S. or Italy
• Are a full-time student who has successfully
completed at least two full course years at
CSU-Pueblo or three full course years at the
University of Bergamo
• Are pursuing an engineering degree through
an accredited program
• Have a minimum GPA of 3.0 (U.S.) or 25 (Italy)
• Speak proficiently in English and Italian
• Have demonstrated leadership achievement
WHEN TO APPLY
The application period is open now for the Fall or
Spring semesters. Once an applicant is selected,
the application period will close. So, if you are
interested in being considered for this unique
learning opportunity, apply now.
HOW TO APPLY
To apply, submit the following to
Professor Caterina Rizzi (Bergamo) at
Caterina.Rizzi@unibg.it or
Professor Chris Picicci (CSU) at
chris.picicci@colostate-pueblo.edu:
• A cover letter explaining your
qualifications, career goals, how you hope
to benefit from a study abroad experience
and what skills you hope to build
• An official copy of your college transcript
• Two letters of recommendation – one
must come from an engineering professor
(if you are a post-graduate student, one
letter must come from a research advisor)
• Your resume or curriculum vitae including
education, academic performance,
WHAT NEXT?
The application and selection process
is governed by SIAD working with the
University of Bergamo and Praxair working
with CSU-Pueblo. Representatives from
each organization make up the scholarship
selection committee. Committee members
(or their designees) will review applications
and interview final applicants. Scholarship
recipients will be informed by the selection
committee associated with your home
country university more...

Thomas R. Pickering Foreign Affairs Fellowship Program Undergraduate
*Must be United States Citizen
*Applicants must be in the sophomore year of undergraduate study with a cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher (on a scale of 4.0).
*Must be interested in becoming Foreign Service Officers in the U.S. Department of State
*Consideration given to applicants who have outstanding leadership skills & demonstrate financial need
*Women, members of minority groups historically underrepresented in the Foreign Service, and students with financial need are encouraged to apply
*Includes full tuition and mandatory fees, living stipend, books, and one round-trip travel between home and school paid during the junior and senior years and during the first year of graduate study, pending availability of funding.
*Junior year summer institute and two summer internships are required.
*Each successful candidate is obligated to a minimum of four and one half years of service in an appointment as a Foreign Service Officer. Candidates who do not successfully complete the program and Foreign Service entry requirements may be subject to a reimbursement obligation to the Department of State
*Undergraduate Program Application deadline: January 24,2014 Recommendations deadline: January 31, 2014 more...

Thomas R. Pickering Graduate Foreign Affairs Fellowship
*Only individuals who are United States citizens
*Applicants must have a minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.2 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
*candidates must be seeking admission to graduate school for the following academic year
*inners are expected to enroll in a two-year, full-time master’s degree program in either public policy, international affairs, public administration, or in an academic field such as business, economics, political science, sociology, or foreign languages
*Graduate Program Application deadline: February 7, 2014 Recommendations deadline: February 14, 2014 more...

Through The Looking Glass Scholarship
*The eligibility requirements for high school seniors and for college students are different:
*High School Seniors. To be eligible, a student must be a high school graduate (or graduating senior), planning to attend a two-year or four-year college in pursuit of an AA, BA or BS degree, and have at least one parent with a disability
*College Students. To be eligible, a student must be currently enrolled in a two-year or four-year college in pursuit of an AA, BA or BS degree, be 21 years of age or younger as of the application deadline, and have at least one parent with a disability.
*Selection for scholarships include academic performance, community activities and service, letter of recommendation and an essay describing the experience of growing up with a parent with a disability. more...

Tillman Military Scholars
Who is eligible to apply for to be a Tillman Military Scholar
Veteran and active servicemembers of both pre- and post-9/11 service
*Servicemembers who wish to start, finish, or further their education: – Those whose benefits have run out or do not meet their needs – Those enrolled as a full-time student at an U.S. institution of higher learning
*Servicemembers of all branches of the U.S. Armed Forces: Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, Coast Guard, National Guard, and Reserve
*Servicemembers pursuing undergraduate, graduate, post-graduate, 2-year, 4-year, public, private, vocational, and trade degrees or certifications
*Dependents of servicemembers (spouses, or children under the age of 30):- Those whose benefits are not transferable from their mother/father/husband/wife – Those who are survivors of a service members – Those whose transferable benefits are not sufficient
*What criteria will be considered for awarding the Tillman Military Scholarships
*Unmet financial need, Educational and career ambitions, Record of personal achievement
*Compelling, thoughtful, genuine, and thorough essay question responses, Demonstration of service to others in the community and a desire to continue such service
*See website for addtional information on scholarship
*Scholarship applications will open February 7 – March 7, 2014 more...

Truckload Carriers Association Scholarship
*Scholarship applications may now originate from college students in any class, not just juniors or seniors. With this decision, the Fund’s trustees hope to help those people who may not be able to start, let alone finish, a higher education given the current economic crisis and who is either -the child, grandchild, or spouse of an employee or an employee of a TCA member; or -the child, grandchild or spouse of an independent contractor affiliated with a TCA member;is eligible for a scholarship.
*The requirement of a 3.3 minimum grade point average has been removed. This change takes into account the impact of “life experiences” on past performance and future success.
*During the judging process, students studying for degrees in tranasportation and business will no longer receive extra points over students pursuing degrees in other fields.
*The scholarship will be awarded without regard to sex, race, color, national origin or religion.
*TCA will start accepting applications in the Spring of 2014. more...

*Has not won the scholarship four (4) times. more...

Varsity Tutors College Scholarship Contest
See Monthly Topic for Essay on website.
Considerations before you submit:
Is your essay between 200 and 900 words?
Did your essay specifically address the question that was asked?
Did you avoid any potentially controversial, racy, or offensive content?
Did you avoid using any explicit or offensive words?
Does your essay follow an organized, multiple-paragraph format?
Did you proofread your essay for grammar and spelling errors?
Have Questions? Contact us at scholarship@varsitytutors.com.
Enter on website.
This is a monthly contest check website for deadlines. more...

Vermont Student Assistance Corporation - Need Based Grant
*Vermont Student Assistance Corporation administers a need-based grant program for Vermont resident.
*Applications will be considered on a first come-first served basis as long as funding is available.
*Students are required to file a Free Application for Federal Aid (FAFSA) in additon to filing a Vermont Grant application.
*Students must be enrolled in a program that is eligible for the Federal Pell Grant Program.
*Only students who are enrolled on a full-time basis (12 credits per semester or equivalent) may be eligible for full-time Vermont Grant; students enrolled 11 credits or less may be eligible for a part-time Vermont Grant. We encourage all students to apply as if they are planning to enroll full-time if their enrollment status is undecided. more...

*Hold a minimum 3.5 grade point average (GPA) or equivalent
*Undergraduate applicants, must have completed at least the first two years of undergraduate education and be a declared biology or pre-veterinary studies major
*Submit a 2,000 word essay on How to Be A Better Pet-Owner: Advice from a Veterinary Student

Walter Scott, Jr. Scholarship Fund

Walter Scott, Jr. Undergraduate Scholarship
1) Full time undergraduate enrolled in the Walter Scott, Jr. College of Engineering at Colorado State University 2) Colorado resident 3) Qualify for and receive CSU’s Green & Gold Scholarship 4) U.S. citizen or legal resident (Should the University award a scholarship to an out-of-state student, the out-of-state Scott Scholar should not be expected to pay more toward their cost of attendance at the University than a Scott Scholar residing in Colorado.)
The scholarship will be renewable as long as student recipients:
1. Maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.0 for the academic year the scholarship is received,
2. Maintain continuous enrollment in an engineering program,
3. Maintain satisfactory progress toward degree completion in engineering,
4. Actively participate in Scott Scholars program activities, seminar and enrichment experiences.
5. To retain the scholarship at the $22,000 annual award level, recipients must continue to live in university housing (CSU dormitories, apartments, or fraternity/sorority housing) each year. If a recipient chooses to live off campus, the scholarship will be reduced to a $15,000 annual award. For both situations, recipients will continue to receive the CSU Green & Gold scholarship.
6. Student recipients may receive the scholarship for up to four years, except for students in the Biomedical Engineering program who may receive the award for up to five years. more...

West Denver Chapter-Trout Unlimited Scholarship
The West Denver Chapter-Trout Unlimited Scholarship is available to graduate students at Colorado State University. You must be involved in research that intends to expand our knowledge and understanding of cold water fisheries to be eligible for this award. The Chapter's primary interest is in research relevant to the maintenance, restoration, or improvement of trout populations and habitat. This could include such topics as diseases, invasive species, water quality, stream bed features, food sources, hatcheries, regulations, or any other subject related to the health of trout populations and habitat. more...

*Maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher or have a GED

Wisdom Scholars
*This scholarship is directed toward students interested in studying sustainable leadership development in fields such as education, business and politics. It is an opportunity for budding leaders to be introduced to the concepts of 21st Century leadership and stimulate their thoughts around business and leadership practices as agents of global transformation.
*Interested students must complete the Wisdom Scholars application and submit two letters of recommendation and a copy of their college transcript.
*Must be a junior or senior in college with a GPA of 2.5 or higher.
*Applications are accepted through June 15, 2013
*To download a copy of the application please see: http://www.wisdom-works.com/wisdom-scholars.html more...

Women's Opportunity Awards/Soroptimist International Of Fort Collins
*Be a woman with primary financial responsibility for supporting your family (including children, spouse, siblings and/or parents)
*Attend or have been accepted to a vocational/skills training program, or an undergraduate degree program
*Have financial need
*Be motivated to achieve your educational & career goals
*Reside in one of Soroptimist International of the Americas’ member countries & territories (Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Costa Rica, Ecuador, Guam, Japan, Korea, Mexico, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Taiwan, United States of America, Venezuela)
*Previous Women’s Opportunity Awards recipients are ineligible to apply. Women who already have an undergraduate degree are ineligible to apply. Soroptimists, employees of Soroptimist, & the immediate families of both are ineligible to apply.
*Application Deadline each year is December 1
*Applications will be availble April 2014. more...

Womens Educational Society (Wes) Scholarships
Scholarship for female, undergraduate students attending Colorado College full-time. Recipients will include five students from each academic class and one transfer student. Selection based on achievement, character and academic promise, as well as financial need. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Woodard Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Adams State College. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA, a minimum 21 ACT score or a minimum 970 SAT score, demonstrate financial need, leadership skills, and a high moral character. Number of awards may vary. A personal letter must be included with application packet. Renewable. more...

Woodard Memorial Scholarship - Adams State College
The Woodard Memorial Scholarship is available to full-time undergraduate students attending Adams State College. You must have a minimum GPA of 2.5, display high moral character and leadership through college, high school and community activities and demonstrate financial need by completing and submitting a FAFSA application to the U.S. Department of Education to be eligible for this award. For full-time undergraduates who have fewer than 12 credit hours, a composite ACT score of 21 or higher or a combined SAT score of 970 or higher is also required. more...

Wrought Iron Art Scholarship
Eligibility is for any student currently enrolled in the school year of 2013/2014 at any college, university, trade or technical school within the United States or Canada.
Students must maintain a cumulative Grade Point Average of at least 3.0 (or the equivalent).
*Students must be 16 years or older at the time of enrollment.
*Must be a Canadian/American citizen or hold a valid student visa.
*Winning participants will be required to submit a photo for promotional purposes
*Eligible students must submit an essay written around one of the two following questions: *The modern use of wrought iron metals in residential construction *The evolution of wrought iron processing/use through 19th – 20th century.
*Each applicant may only submit one essay for consideration. Submissions should be sent via e-mail along with a cover letter including: legal name, mailing address, telephone number, a brief biography and the name of the school to scholarship@art-metal.ca
*A minimum of 500 words in length with a maximum of 3,000.
*Proper citation of any and all research material used.
*Winners will be announced January 15, 2014 on the Art Metal scholarship page more...

Wts/Women's Transportation Seminar Chapter Of Colorado
*Open to women
*GPA of 3.0 or higher
*Sharon Banks Memorial Undergrauate Scholarship and Helene M. Overly Graduate Scholarship are available through the Colroado Chapter of Advancing Women in Transportation. Each have specific criteria to meet. You need to submit applications to the local chapter. more...

Wyoming, Csu Alumni Scholarship
Annual award for a Wyoming resident who is an incoming freshmen accepted to Colorado State University full-time. Selection is based on financial need and merit. Applicant must be an U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Submit a completed Private Scholarship Application, and a FAFSA application. Non-renewable. more...

Xerox Technical Minority Scholarship Program
*Full-time student enrolled at a four-year institution, B average or better.
*Be seeking a BS, MS, or PhD in a technical science or an engineering discipline.
*Do you consider yourself Black, Asian, Pacific Islander, Native American, Alaskan, or Hispanic
*Do you have tuition (or tuition related) expenses not covered by scholarships/grants (excluding loans)
*Click on Why Xerox then pull down list, you will see minority scholarship.
*available March 1, 2014 more...

Y Cross Ranch Scholarship
1) Full-time undergraduate junior or senior 2) Any major within Agricultural Sciences 3) Overall 3.25 GPA in any major 4) Student’s intent should be to return to the family ranch after graduation or pursue career in ranch management more...

Ynez Morey & Chuck Reagin Memorial Forestry Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate junior or senior students attending Colorado State University full-time, majoring in Forestry or Range & Forestry Management in the College of Natural Resources. Applicants must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and financial need. Due date varies. more...
